Cool night air cleared Evelyn's head instantly.

She turned to Harrison. "Did their comments bother you?"

His brow furrowed in confusion.

When their eyes met, he shook his head slowly. "They merely voiced what I've long thought."

Evelyn's pulse hammered so loudly she feared he might hear it.

Harrison's gaze held oceans of unspoken words.

Finally, he breathed, "Evelyn... when will you let me prove myself to you?"
###Chapter 308 Filled With Regret

Evelyn quickly averted her gaze, her cheeks flushing with warmth.

Even after Harrison's heartfelt confession, she couldn't bring herself to respond properly.

The world seemed to pause around them.

After what felt like eternity, Harrison reached out, gently tucking a loose strand of hair behind her ear.

"There's no rush for an answer. Take all the time you need." His voice was soft yet firm.

Only then did Evelyn dare to meet his eyes.

Flashes of their shared moments played through her mind like a cherished film reel.

Would she ever find someone who understood her so completely?

"Harrison, I just need a little more time," she whispered.

He simply nodded. "Whatever you need."

Evelyn drew a deep breath, her gaze drifting to the horizon.

Despite her efforts to move forward, fragments of the past clung stubbornly to her heart.

The memory of Nathan Sterling, the passionate young man who'd fought for justice on campus, surfaced unexpectedly.

But that man no longer existed.

"Let me see Ms. Carter immediately!"

"I'm sorry, miss. Ms. Carter is attending a private function."

At the estate gates, security struggled to contain Vivienne Chambers' determined advance.

The confrontation escalated as Vivienne shoved against the guards.

"Look at these gifts! They're for Ms. Carter personally. Can't you make an exception?"

"Without Ms. Carter's authorization, I can't permit entry." The guard remained unmoved.

Vivienne stamped her designer heel in frustration, her plans thwarted.

Just then, Evelyn and Harrison emerged. Spotting Evelyn, Vivienne's face lit up with exaggerated enthusiasm.

"Ms. Carter! Vivienne Chambers from Sterling Enterprises. We've met before, remember?"

Evelyn's brow furrowed in suspicion.

The head guard approached. "Ms. Carter, this woman has been causing a disturbance."

With a dismissive wave, Evelyn said, "Let her through."

Vivienne practically sprinted forward.

"Ms. Carter!" She beamed. "I've come to apologize properly."

She presented an ostentatious array of gifts - luxury skincare, rare cosmetics, imported supplements.

Evelyn blinked in surprise. "This isn't necessary, Ms. Chambers."

But Vivienne pressed on. "I know you must still be upset. Giselle was the one who barred your entry."

"That incompetent girl has been terminated. Consider this her comeuppance."

Evelyn studied Vivienne carefully.

With measured calm, she remarked, "Interesting. Wasn't Giselle your personal assistant?"
###Chapter 309 The Mysterious Delivery

Vivienne's face drained of color as she stammered, "That... that's all behind us now. She means nothing to me anymore."

Evelyn wasn't foolish. The way Vivienne was acting today—so different from before—could only mean one thing.

It was obvious. Vivienne must have discovered her true identity.

Evelyn laughed, but her eyes remained cold.

"Ms. Chambers, an assistant wouldn’t dare pull such a stunt on her own unless... she had orders from higher up."

Vivienne paled further, her lips parting to explain.

But Evelyn had no interest in hearing excuses.

"Ms. Chambers, focus on your work instead of meddling in pointless affairs. In business, results speak louder than words."

With that, Evelyn turned on her heel and strode away with Harrison in tow. The conversation was over.

Vivienne stood frozen, regret twisting in her gut like a knife.

—

After Kingsley Industries secured the partnership with Summit Corporation, Summit's stock skyrocketed.

By market close, their valuation had surged by 10%.

Companies that had been hesitating between Sterling Enterprises and Summit now rushed to align with the latter.

The two corporations had been neck-and-neck before. But in mere days, Summit pulled ahead, leaving Sterling Enterprises in the dust.

The day after signing the contract, Evelyn returned to Pamore.

As she stepped into the office, Julian Hawthorne was already waiting. His smile widened when he saw her.

"Ms. Carter, welcome back."

Evelyn offered a polite smile. "The deal is done, so I returned. Did you need something, Mr. Hawthorne?"

Julian chuckled. "Just heard some rumors. They said you had a little... incident in Dunhill. Came to check on you. Glad to see you're unharmed."

Evelyn arched a brow. "Appreciate the concern. I'm fine. With a project this big, I can't afford to be anything but."

Julian's smile tightened. "Of course! The company thrives with you leading the charge."

Evelyn gave a slight nod and moved past him into her office. The moment the door shut, her smile vanished.

She turned to Maxwell immediately. "Any leads on Maximilian?"

Maxwell shook his head. "He operates like a ghost. Tracing him is... complicated."

Evelyn drummed her fingers on the desk. "If conventional methods fail, send our contacts on the dark web after him. I refuse to believe he's untraceable."

"Yes, Ms. Carter."

Just then, another assistant knocked and entered. "Ms. Carter, there's a package for you!"

Evelyn frowned. She hadn’t ordered anything recently.

"Who sent it?"

The assistant checked the parcel. "No sender information."

Evelyn hesitated. "Bring it here."

But Maxwell intercepted. "Let me."

He took the package, testing its weight. Light—likely documents.

"Ms. Carter, allow me to open it first."
###Chapter 310 Isabella's Challenge

Evelyn gave a firm nod. Maxwell produced a sleek pocket knife and sliced open the mysterious package. Photos spilled across the floor like fallen leaves.

He scrambled to collect them, handing the stack to Evelyn. "Ms. Carter, you need to see this!"

The corner of Evelyn's lips curled upward as she examined the images.

"Now the puzzle pieces fit."

She never imagined the puppet master pulling strings would be someone from her past. "Since Isabella's involved, this game just got more entertaining."

A chilling smile played on Evelyn's lips. "Last time, she got off easy with just a few months behind bars. This time, I'll teach her some people are better left untouched."

"Shall I handle this discreetly for you?" Maxwell offered.

Evelyn waved him off. "No need. I'll personally deal with this viper."

Meanwhile, Isabella remained blissfully unaware her scheme had unraveled. She pranced through Dunhill's luxury district, convinced Evelyn was already six feet under.

Nathan's black card burned a hole in her designer purse as she indulged in a shopping spree. Bodyguards struggled under the weight of her purchases before she finally called it quits.

Her manicured finger pointed at Evelyn's boutique. "I want this place secured immediately!" she announced to her entourage. "We're transforming it into a high-end beauty emporium - imported cosmetics, luxury skincare, the works."

"Add some aestheticians for treatments too," she continued, eyes gleaming. "These vapid socialites will empty their trust funds here."

Unbeknownst to her, Olivia observed from the shadows.

Without hesitation, Olivia grabbed a nearby water basin and hurled its contents at Isabella.

A piercing shriek echoed through the boutique.

Isabella stood frozen, designer outfit ruined, mascara running down her cheeks.

Olivia smirked. "Having delusions of grandeur, are we? Need help coming back to reality?"

Isabella wiped her face with trembling hands, her perfect facade crumbling. "You bitch!" she screeched. "Do you know who I am? I'll ruin you!"

She lunged like a feral cat.

Olivia didn't flinch, her gaze icy.

At the last second, she caught Isabella's wrist, swept her legs, and sent her crashing to the floor.

The impact shook the display cases.

Isabella writhed like an overturned beetle, screeching obscenities.

Olivia dusted her hands. "All that arrogance for such pathetic skills. Didn't do your research on me, did you?"

Every bone in Isabella's body ached. She hadn't anticipated Evelyn's mousy friend packing such force.

She couldn't even stand without her bodyguards' help.

"Are you statues?" she screamed at them. "Get me up!"

They scrambled to obey, hauling her to her feet.

Leaning heavily on them, she still managed to sneer. "Your precious Evelyn's rotting in a ditch somewhere. Let's see who protects you now!"
###Chapter 311 She Spoke to You

Olivia's face paled instantly. "What did you just say?"

Isabella's lips curled into a vicious smirk at her reaction.

The moment she'd been anticipating had finally arrived.

"Don't believe me? It's the truth. Evelyn might as well be dead in Dunhill by now. The news will reach here soon enough."

Olivia's entire body trembled with rage. She snatched up a nearby broom and swung it wildly at Isabella.

"You venomous snake! Homewrecking trash! How dare you spread such lies? I'll beat the life out of you!"

Isabella dodged easily, her laughter ringing through the boutique. "Go ahead! Scream all you want!"

"Your curses won't bring Evelyn back. They might not even find her body intact."

"Better start planning her funeral. Maybe if you pray hard enough, she'll haunt you from the afterlife."

Olivia's eyes burned crimson. Without warning, she lunged forward and delivered a stinging slap across Isabella's cheek.

But Isabella barely flinched, her laughter growing louder. Her bodyguards immediately restrained Olivia.

They pinned her arms behind her back as she struggled uselessly, finally shoving her toward the store entrance.

Isabella's mocking laughter followed. She adjusted her designer dress with one hand, the other resting on her hip.

"Pathetic. Evelyn was never a match for me. What a shame I couldn't watch the life drain from her eyes myself!"

With that final barb, she turned on her heel and strutted away, leaving Olivia shell-shocked.

Olivia stood frozen, the world spinning around her.

When reality crashed back, she fumbled for her phone with shaking hands and dialed Evelyn's number.

No answer. She tried again. And again. Each unanswered call felt like another knife to her heart.

Tears streamed down her face as she collapsed against the wall.

"Evelyn, please pick up!"

After the tenth attempt, Olivia hurled her phone across the room and sank to the floor, sobbing uncontrollably.

Meanwhile, Evelyn was concluding an important board meeting at Kingsley Industries. Her phone remained with her assistant.

"Ms. Carter," the assistant said urgently, handing over the device. "You've missed fifteen calls from Ms. Sinclair."

Evelyn's brow furrowed at the notification screen. She immediately returned the call.

Olivia remained curled in a ball, deaf to the world around her.

The persistent ringing finally pierced her grief. Seeing Evelyn's name flash across the screen, she gasped.

"Evelyn! You're alive!" Her voice cracked with relief.

Evelyn's tone sharpened instantly. "Olivia? What's wrong?"

Olivia burst into fresh tears - this time of joy. "You're okay! Thank God you're okay!"

Wiping her face, Olivia's relief turned to fury. "That wretched Isabella told me you were dead! If I see her again, I'll claw her eyes out!"

Understanding dawned on Evelyn. "Isabella spoke to you?"
###Chapter 312 Meeting Maximilian

Olivia let out a frustrated sigh. "That wretched Isabella is becoming insufferable with her arrogance."

Evelyn placed a calming hand on her friend's shoulder. "Let her enjoy her moment of triumph. Her downfall will come soon enough."

A dangerous glimmer flashed in Evelyn's emerald eyes.

As she ended the call, Maxwell entered the office. "Ms. Carter, we've arranged the meeting with Maximilian. He's expecting us at Blackwood Manor tomorrow at 8 pm."

Evelyn's lips curved into a predatory smile. "Inform him we wouldn't miss it for the world."

Maxwell hesitated. "Should we notify Kingsley Industries headquarters in Frenda? Perhaps arrange additional security?"

"Unnecessary. Our local team will suffice." Evelyn waved a dismissive hand. "This is a civilized society. They wouldn't dare attempt anything foolish in public."

"Understood, Ms. Carter."

After Maxwell departed, Evelyn moved to the floor-to-ceiling windows, surveying the glittering cityscape below.

Her manicured nails tapped an ominous rhythm against the glass as calculations played behind her piercing gaze.

The following evening at precisely 7 pm, a discreet security detail waited at Kingsley Industries' private entrance.

Evelyn had kept her plans to herself. Slipping into the waiting armored vehicle alone, she gave the driver a single nod.

The sleek black car, specially modified with bulletproof glass and reinforced panels, glided through the city streets toward Blackwood Manor.

"We've arrived, Ms. Carter."

Evelyn stepped out in a tailored black pantsuit that accentuated her lethal elegance. The crisp lines of her jacket emphasized her slender frame as she approached the manor's imposing doors.

A deep chuckle greeted her arrival.

"How bold of you to come alone, Ms. Carter. I do admire courage."

Her gaze lifted to find a heavyset man in his forties occupying the head chair. Time had softened Maximilian Blackwood's physique but not his calculating eyes.

"Maximilian, your reputation precedes you."

Evelyn strode forward with effortless confidence. Only then did she notice the silent observer seated beside Maximilian - a man whose intense stare had followed her since she entered.

She recognized him instantly.

Sebastian Blackwood. The man from the photographs with Isabella.

Sebastian's expression darkened as he studied Evelyn with newfound interest.

"Please, join us, Ms. Carter!" Maximilian gestured expansively before snapping at a servant. "Don't just stand there! Pour our guest some of the '89 Bordeaux."

Evelyn didn't flinch.

Her attention caught on the intricate chessboard between them. The game appeared evenly matched, neither side claiming clear advantage.

"Tell me, Ms. Carter," Maximilian leaned forward, eyes gleaming, "what do you make of our little game?"

Chess happened to be Maximilian's sole indulgence, yet worthy opponents had eluded him for years.

But Evelyn hadn't come to play games.

A faint smile touched her lips. "I've dabbled in chess, though I wouldn't presume to challenge an expert."

Sebastian's mouth quirked. "You underestimate yourself, Ms. Carter." Turning to Maximilian, he suggested, "Why not test her skills?"

Maximilian's interest visibly piqued. "An excellent notion! What say you, Ms. Carter?"

Evelyn arched one perfectly shaped brow. She hadn't forgotten her purpose. "Before we discuss games, Maximilian, perhaps you'd care to explain your organization's recent activities at Dunhill?"
###Chapter 313 The Serpent's Mask

Maximilian Blackwood remained oblivious to the situation. His brow furrowed as he questioned, "Excuse me, what was that about?"

Evelyn Carter's lips curled into a chilling smile. "We're well past the point of pretending, don't you think?"

The temperature in the room seemed to drop as Maximilian's expression darkened. He turned sharply to Sebastian Blackwood. "Explain yourself. What exactly did you do to provoke Ms. Carter?"

Sebastian's face twisted into something ugly as he leaned in to whisper urgently to his boss.

The moment the words registered, Maximilian slammed his fist on the table with a resounding crack. "You brainless imbecile!"

Sebastian recoiled, hands raised in placation. "Max, calm down. It was just... a momentary lapse in judgment."

Maximilian visibly struggled to compose himself before Evelyn's piercing gaze.

Sebastian had been his most trusted lieutenant for nearly a decade. Sacrificing him over some woman, no matter how influential, wasn't an option.

With practiced charm, Maximilian offered a conciliatory smile. "Ms. Carter, surely there's been some misunderstanding?"

Evelyn's fingers tapped rhythmically against her thigh. "I nearly died, Maximilian. What part of that sounds like a misunderstanding to you?"

Maximilian knew exactly who Evelyn was. While he commanded considerable power in the city's underworld, even he couldn't openly challenge the Kingsley heiress.

Playing the gracious host, he poured a crystal glass of bourbon and extended it toward Evelyn. "My associate acted foolishly. Consider this drink my personal apology. Let's put this unfortunate incident behind us."

The glass shattered against the marble floor before it could reach her hands, amber liquid spreading like blood across the tiles.

Sebastian lunged forward, face contorted with rage. "You ungrateful bitch! Max is being more than generous here!"

Evelyn's gaze never wavered. "What do I want? Simple. Your head on a silver platter."

Her words hung in the air like a guillotine's blade. Even the hardened men in the room suppressed shivers at the steel in her voice.

Sebastian barked out a laugh, though his eyes remained deadly serious. "Take my life? You'll need more than pretty words to manage that."

Evelyn examined her manicure with feigned disinterest. "I wouldn't be standing here if I didn't have exactly what it takes."

Maximilian stepped between them, hands raised. "Ms. Carter, please. This hostility isn't good for anyone's health."

But Evelyn's mind was made up. This man had tried to kill her. There would be no mercy.

"Your choice, Maximilian. Hand him over or face the consequences."

Sebastian bristled at her tone. "Since when do we let some spoiled socialite make demands? Say the word, Max, and I'll handle this nuisance."

A single sharp gesture from Maximilian silenced him instantly.

Returning to his seat, Maximilian studied the chessboard before him with sudden intensity. "A game, Ms. Carter? Winner takes all."

"Max, this is ridiculous!" Sebastian protested. "Just let me deal with her!"

"Silence!" The roar was so uncharacteristic that even Evelyn blinked. The carefully constructed mask of civility had slipped, revealing the predator beneath.

Sebastian fell back, properly cowed for the first time that evening.
###Chapter 314 Chess Is a Gamble

"Ms. Carter, what's your decision?"

Evelyn could see right through Maximilian's scheme, but she stood her ground. "Maximilian, before we play, you owe me an explanation."

Maximilian reset the chessboard with practiced ease. As each piece clicked into place, his voice remained steady. "Simple. This game decides everything."

"If you win, Sebastian walks free with no interference from me. Lose, and we pretend this never happened."

The unspoken message was clear - this chess match carried higher stakes than any casino.

Sebastian's tense shoulders relaxed slightly. He knew this was Maximilian's way of protecting him.

After all, in all of Sterling City, no one could match Maximilian's strategic brilliance at chess.

Evelyn didn't stand a chance.

"Well, Ms. Carter? Do we have a deal?"

Sebastian smirked, already anticipating Evelyn's inevitable defeat.

Evelyn shook her head.

Maximilian's face darkened, assuming she was refusing - until she countered, "These stakes seem... inadequate for a gamble of this magnitude."

Interest flickered in Maximilian's eyes.

"What do you propose?"

Evelyn met his gaze unflinchingly. "Let's raise the stakes properly, shall we?"

"I've noticed you've held power for quite some time. Perhaps it's time for a regime change."

Sebastian exploded. "Evelyn! You dare challenge Maximilian's leadership? You'd have to go through every one of us first!"

Evelyn ignored his outburst, keeping her focus on Maximilian.

"Lose, and I take control of your little empire. How's that for stakes?"

Maximilian's expression turned thunderous as he weighed her words.

Seeing her deadly seriousness, he suddenly grinned. "Very well, Ms. Carter. Should you win, I'll surrender my position. I'll acknowledge you as our new leader and follow your every command."

Gasps rippled through the room.

No one had expected their leader to wager their entire organization on a chess game.

The fate of their syndicate now rested on sixty-four squares.

As murmurs spread, Maximilian added, "But if I win, not only do we forget this unpleasantness... you'll become my wife."

The room erupted.

Chants of "Maximilian! Maximilian!" filled the air.

Evelyn's knuckles turned white with suppressed fury.

She silently vowed to make every single one of them regret this moment.

"Well?" Maximilian prompted.

After a tense pause, Evelyn gritted out, "Begin."

The crowd roared as attention shifted to the chessboard.

Evelyn chose white, Maximilian black. Her first move launched their high-stakes duel.

Every spectator held their breath as the game unfolded.

At first, Maximilian played with casual confidence. But as the match progressed, his smirk faded, replaced by deepening concentration.
###Chapter 315 Victory and Defeat

Sebastian Blackwood leaned against the wall, his voice barely above a whisper. "Maximilian, perhaps we should pause for a moment?"

Maximilian Blackwood shot him a sharp glare. "Silence during chess. Have you forgotten the most fundamental rule?"

Sebastian pressed his lips together and turned his attention to Evelyn Carter.

She sat perfectly composed, her expression unreadable. Even with her entire future at stake in this game, not a single tremor shook her steady hands.

Sebastian smirked inwardly. She was putting on quite the performance.

"Wait! You can't take my bishop!"

Maximilian suddenly reached out, stopping Evelyn's move mid-air. "That was a mistake."

He snatched his piece back with a scoff. "Sebastian distracted me. Ms. Carter, surely you'll allow me to retract that move?"

Evelyn didn't speak, but her raised eyebrow spoke volumes.

Maximilian shifted uncomfortably in his seat. After decades of playing, he knew better than to ask for such concessions.

He clenched his jaw. "Fine. Take it then."

As he removed his piece from the board, the tide of the game turned decisively in Evelyn's favor.

Beads of sweat formed on Maximilian's brow. In all his years, he'd never faced an opponent like this.

Evelyn's skill was nothing short of remarkable.

The game intensified, each move calculated with precision. An hour passed without either player gaining clear advantage. The tension in the room was palpable.

"Ms. Carter, you're the first to ever challenge me like this. I'm impressed you've lasted this long."

Maximilian had played chess for over twenty years.

Most opponents didn't survive thirty moves against him, yet Evelyn was clearly his equal.

"You flatter me, Maximilian. My grandfather taught me as a child. I rarely play these days."

Maximilian's eyes widened at her words.

A casual player was matching him move for move?

"Your modesty does you credit, Ms. Carter."

Evelyn's hand hovered over the board before making the decisive move. "Checkmate."

Maximilian's fingers trembled. His king stood trapped, surrounded on all sides. His mouth fell open in disbelief.

He had lost.

Sebastian rushed forward, scanning the board frantically. "This can't be right! How could you lose?"

But the evidence lay before them, undeniable in its finality.

Evelyn leaned back, perfectly at ease. "Well, Maximilian? Your verdict?"

Maximilian closed his eyes, swallowing his pride.

Then he straightened his shoulders and exhaled sharply. "I concede defeat."

The room fell into stunned silence. Even Sebastian stood frozen, his face draining of color.

Maximilian had lost.

Which meant Evelyn would now take control of the organization.

And she would certainly settle accounts for his past actions. Sebastian could already feel cold sweat trickling down his spine.

"Maximilian! It's just a game! This doesn't count!"

Maximilian rubbed his temples before fixing Sebastian with an icy stare. "A man's word is his bond. Ms. Carter won fairly."

Rising to his feet, Maximilian extended his hand toward Evelyn.

"Ms. Carter, I yield to you. You have my respect."
###Chapter 316 She's The Boss

The crowd erupted in unison, their voices thundering through the warehouse. "Boss!"

Sebastian Blackwood's face twisted in disbelief as he watched the scene unfold. His hands clenched into fists, nails digging into his palms. This couldn't be happening.

Everyone was bowing to Evelyn Carter. His future in the organization was over.

"Sebastian!" Maximilian Blackwood's voice cut through the tension like a whip. "On your knees! Beg Ms. Carter for mercy!"

Sebastian's jaw tightened. But he had no choice. With visible reluctance, he dropped to his knees.

Evelyn blinked in surprise. She hadn't expected Maximilian to hold such sway over his men. Impressive.

"Thank you," she said simply.

Maximilian barked orders, and his men formed perfect lines like soldiers.

He approached Evelyn with newfound respect. "Ms. Carter, we're at your service now. Sebastian's fate is yours to decide."

Evelyn tapped her chin thoughtfully. "I don't want his life. Just one small favor."

Sebastian exhaled in relief. Temporary reprieve.

"Ev—Ms. Carter," he corrected hastily. "Name it."

"An eye for an eye," Evelyn said coolly. "Simple, isn't it?"

Sebastian hesitated. Isabella Delaney had been his lover for years. Could he really...?

Evelyn noticed his pause. Her icy gaze pinned him in place. "Problem?"

She leaned closer, her presence overwhelming. "Or would you prefer to take her punishment yourself?"

Sebastian shuddered.

No choice at all.

Self-preservation won.

"Three days," he choked out. "You'll have what you want."

Evelyn nodded, satisfied.

As she turned to leave, Maximilian stopped her. "Ms. Carter, your orders?"

"I'll call when needed. You're in charge until then."

Maximilian bowed. "Safe travels, Ms. Carter!"

The chorus followed her out. "Safe travels, Ms. Carter!"

The deference was night and day from her arrival. Outside, Harrison Whitmore leaned against his car, arms crossed.

He pushed off the vehicle, storming toward her.

Evelyn's stomach dropped. "Harrison? What are you—"

His hand came up, ruffling her hair roughly. "Evelyn Carter," he growled. "Do you have a death wish?"

She blinked up at him.

"Maximilian Blackwood isn't some street thug. He's Pamore's most dangerous crime lord. Ruthless. Unpredictable."

Evelyn fought a smile. She'd found the man rather... puppy-like, actually.

"Harrison, look at me. I'm fine."

He exhaled sharply. His men had reported everything, but the what-ifs haunted him. What if something had gone wrong?

"Promise me," he demanded, cupping her face. "No more solo missions. You tell me first."
###Chapter 317 The Truth Revealed

Evelyn gave a compliant nod, her voice steady. "I've got this, Harrison. No need to worry."

"With Maximilian pledging loyalty to you now," Harrison continued, "navigating Sterling Enterprises will be significantly smoother for you."

This turn of events caught Evelyn off guard. In her mind, she'd merely acquired another reluctant subordinate.

She couldn't have known this seemingly minor decision would send shockwaves through Sterling Enterprises' underground network.

—

Isabella remained blissfully unaware of the unfolding drama.

At this very moment, she sat before the vanity in her hotel suite, meticulously applying her makeup. A self-satisfied smile curved her lips as she admired her reflection.

A sharp knock interrupted her preening. Her face lit up as she hurried to answer.

"Darling, I've been waiting—"

The door swung open to reveal Sebastian, but unlike their usual private encounters, he stood flanked by several imposing bodyguards.

Isabella's smile faltered. "Sebastian? What's with the entourage today?"

His expression remained grim. Without answering, he dismissed his men with a curt gesture before stepping inside and shutting the door behind him.

She approached him with practiced ease. "Sebastian, what's bothering you today? Let me fix that for you."

Her manicured fingers trailed down his chest, inching dangerously lower—

Until his hand clamped around her wrist, stopping her mid-motion.

"Enough. Not today."

Isabella froze. In all their years together, Sebastian had never spoken to her with such icy detachment. Forcing a smile, she tried again.

"So... about Evelyn Carter. Is she... taken care of?"

At the mention of Evelyn, Sebastian turned slowly, his gaze piercing. "What do you think?"

Missing the warning in his tone, Isabella laughed brightly. "That wretched girl finally got what she deserved! No one humiliates Isabella Delaney and—"

"Wake up," Sebastian cut in coldly. "Your fantasy ends here."

Her smile slipped. "What... what do you mean? Did something go wrong?"

Sebastian's laugh held no humor. "Of all people, Isabella, why did you have to cross Evelyn Carter? Even I underestimated her."

Regret gnawed at him now.

Why had he ever agreed to help Isabella? He'd assumed Evelyn was just another spoiled heiress. Who could have predicted Maximilian Blackwood himself would swear fealty to her? As Maximilian's subordinate, Sebastian stood no chance against Evelyn's newfound power.

Isabella's face drained of color. "She's... still alive?"

Sebastian's nod confirmed her worst fears.

She knew Evelyn. If she survived, she'd dig until she uncovered the truth. And when she did...

"Sebastian... she won't trace this back to me, will she?"

He tilted her chin up with one finger, his smile chilling. "Scared now, little dove?"

For the first time, Isabella found Sebastian's gaze unrecognizable—and terrifying.

"You'll protect me, won't you?" Her voice trembled as tears welled up. "Please, Sebastian! Don't let her get to me! I'm begging you!"
###Chapter 318 Nathan Intervenes

No matter how desperately Isabella begged, Sebastian stood his ground. Eventually, he shoved her away with brutal force.

"Guards!" Sebastian barked. "Restrain her immediately."

Silence.

His brow furrowed as he stormed toward the doorway. "I gave you an order! Are you all deaf—"

The words died in his throat.

Nathan Sterling's piercing gaze locked onto him, radiating such intensity that Sebastian instinctively stepped back.

"Mr. Sterling? To what do we owe this... unexpected visit?"

Nathan ignored him, striding past into the room. When Isabella saw him, hope flashed across her tear-streaked face.

She scrambled forward. "Nathan! Thank God you're here! Please, you have to help me!"

He halted abruptly.

Looking down at her, his expression held no sympathy—only cold disdain.

"Mr. Sterling," Sebastian ventured cautiously, "surely you're not here for her?" Isabella's eyes lit up.

"Take me away from here!" she pleaded, clutching Nathan's sleeve. "I'll do anything! I swear I'll never bother Evelyn again!"

Nathan's lips curled in a humorless smile. His voice cut like ice. "Sebastian. I'm taking her. You'll have her back in two hours."

Confusion flickered across Sebastian's face, but he knew better than to challenge Nathan directly.

He shot Isabella a venomous look. "Mr. Sterling, is this treacherous woman really worth your time? Let me dispose of her in Dunhill's slums—"

Nathan didn't even glance his way. "This isn't a negotiation. It's a courtesy notification."

With that, he signaled his men. They seized Isabella roughly, ignoring Sebastian's darkening expression.

Fury erupted as Sebastian slammed his fist into the wall. "This isn't over, Sterling."

...

Nathan brought Isabella to an elegant Victorian townhouse.

His guards threw her to the marble floor without ceremony.

Struggling up, Isabella approached Nathan with desperate hope. "You still care about me, don't you? Get me out of Pamore—"

"Enough." Nathan's voice froze her in place. "I want the truth, Isabella. Nothing more."

"The... truth?" Her confusion seemed genuine.

Nathan turned slowly. His gaze bored into her. "That child. Whose was it really?"

Three seconds of silence. Then understanding dawned.

Seeing his grim expression, Isabella suddenly laughed—a wild, triumphant sound echoing through the grand hall.

When her laughter subsided, a calculating gleam entered her eyes. "So that's why you came? For Evelyn's sake, isn't it?"

Nathan remained impassive. "Answer the question."

She shook her head, smirking. "Why not believe it was yours, Nathan? The evidence is gone now. Who can prove otherwise?"

Her voice dripped with smug satisfaction, as if she'd finally found leverage against the mighty Nathan Sterling.
###Chapter 319 The Ultimatum

Evelyn's patience snapped. "I won't apologize. She earned every bit of that slap."

Kimberly Fairchild wiped fake tears, playing the victim. "It's fine, Sylvia. I'm sure she didn't mean it."

Her performance only fueled Sylvia's outrage.

"Last chance. Apologize, or I'll have you thrown out immediately."

Evelyn's laugh was icy. "Try it."

Sylvia's fingers flew across her phone. "Security to the east terrace. We have a disturbance."

Hanging up, she smirked. "You brought this on yourself, Evelyn."

A few guests recognized Evelyn's connection to Nathan Sterling and tried mediating. "Ms. Montgomery, perhaps let this go?"

Sylvia scoffed. "Let it go? After she assaulted someone?"

Seeing her resolve, they backed off—no point angering either powerful woman.

Evelyn calmly retrieved her phone. "I didn't hit her unprovoked. The proof is right here."

The crowd buzzed with anticipation.

"She recorded it? Play it!"

"Let's hear the truth!"

Kimberly paled, lunging for the device. Evelyn sidestepped effortlessly.

Then Kimberly's voice rang out, crystal clear:

"Everyone knows you're just a gold-digging mistress. Does Nathan Sterling even remember your name?"

The crowd's expressions shifted instantly.

"Holy hell. She called her a mistress to her face!"

"That slap was overdue."

"What trash talks like that at a gala?"

"Check the guest list—I bet she crashed."

Sylvia's face darkened. She hadn't counted on Evelyn's recording.

Kimberly shrank under the glares, her earlier bravado crumbling.

Evelyn pocketed her phone. "Still want that apology, Sylvia?"

The security team arrived, hesitating at the tense scene.

Sylvia's jaw tightened. This wasn't the humiliation she'd planned—but it was the one she'd gotten.
###Chapter 331 The Tables Turn

"Don't believe a word she's saying. It's all lies." Kimberly scrambled to defend herself.

Just then, Adrian came rushing over. His long strides carried him directly to Evelyn, concern etched across his handsome features.

"Are you alright, Ms. Carter?"

Evelyn gave a casual shrug. "Perfectly fine."

But Adrian had already heard the damning recording. His voice turned icy. "Ms. Carter is a distinguished guest I personally invited. Do you honestly think you can disrespect her like this?"

The crowd fell silent under Adrian's authoritative tone, people dispersing with awkward murmurs.

Sylvia stood frozen in shock.

She couldn't comprehend why Adrian Prescott would show such deference to Evelyn. Blinking rapidly, she pasted on a bright smile and approached.

"Mr. Prescott, I'm Sylvia Montgomery from Radiant Electronics. What an honor to meet you."

Her attempt at flattery fell flat as Adrian completely ignored her. Instead, he turned to Kimberly beside her.

"Did you just insult Evelyn?"

Kimberly looked utterly bewildered, still processing the sudden turn of events.

Without hesitation, Adrian signaled security. "Escort her out immediately."

The guards moved swiftly, efficiently removing a protesting Kimberly from the premises.

With that handled, Adrian guided Evelyn inside, leaving Sylvia gaping after them.

Now more than ever, Sylvia burned with curiosity about Evelyn's true identity.

The moment Evelyn entered the main hall, she became the center of attention. Important guests approached her with respectful greetings, which she acknowledged with polite grace.

Sylvia's stomach twisted with conflicting emotions as she witnessed the scene.

Then Dominic Kingsley made his entrance.

Sylvia's gaze instantly locked onto the powerful CEO. She quickly smoothed her dress and checked her reflection before approaching.

"Mr. Kingsley, I'm Sylvia Montgomery from Radiant Electronics. What a pleasant surprise to meet you here today. The honor is entirely mine."

She extended her hand with practiced charm.

Dominic remained stone-faced, leaving her hand hanging awkwardly in mid-air. Undeterred, Sylvia pressed on. "Mr. Kingsley, did you come alone tonight? Perhaps I could show you around?"

Dominic's response was curt. "That won't be necessary, Ms. Montgomery."

His gaze had already found Evelyn across the room. "If you'll excuse me."

With that, he strode purposefully toward Evelyn.

The gathered elite exchanged knowing glances. When someone of Dominic Kingsley's stature showed such clear preference, everyone took notice.

"Mr. Kingsley, might we know who this is?"

Someone dared to voice the question burning in everyone's minds.

Sylvia followed the exchange, her eyes darkening with jealousy. She'd never imagined Dominic would be so familiar with Evelyn.

What exactly was their relationship?

The answer seemed obvious, yet Sylvia refused to accept it. Her nails dug into her palms as she fought to maintain composure.

As the anticipation built, Dominic made the announcement with evident pride. "This is Evelyn Carter, the jewel of the Kingsley family. Our most treasured princess."

The revelation sent shockwaves through the crowd.

No one had guessed that Evelyn was the legendary Kingsley heiress.

Sylvia's legs nearly gave way beneath her.

She'd just offended the Kingsley family's beloved daughter.

"Ms. Carter, your business acumen is legendary. You've proven yourself every bit your brothers' equal in managing Kingsley Industries. What an honor to finally meet the brilliant mind behind such success."
###Chapter 332 The Price of Arrogance

"Ms. Carter, I specialize in international commerce and would be honored to establish a partnership with Kingsley Industries."

"Our firm handles global supply chain solutions. We'd appreciate your expert guidance moving forward."

Evelyn maintained her poised smile as the crowd showered her with admiration, her dignified demeanor earning numerous favorable impressions.

Several business leaders immediately proposed collaborations. Seizing the moment, Evelyn secured multiple lucrative contracts for Kingsley Industries.

Sylvia watched the scene unfold with growing horror.

Her carefully constructed world had shattered the instant Dominic revealed Evelyn's true identity.

She stood frozen, remembering all the times she'd mocked and belittled Evelyn during their school days. The bitter taste of regret filled her mouth.

She'd ruined everything.

"Sylvia! Why are you just standing there? I told you to network with Ms. Carter and secure contracts!" Conrad Montgomery hissed as he pulled his daughter aside.

Sylvia barely registered her father's words. Her nails dug crescent moons into her palms, but she felt no pain.

She couldn't possibly tell her father she'd already burned that bridge. Instead, she forced a smile.

"Of course, Father. I'll handle it." With false confidence, Sylvia approached Evelyn.

She inhaled deeply, steeling herself to swallow her pride. By the time she reached Evelyn, her smile looked painfully bright.

"Evelyn, let me propose a toast! To our unexpected reunion!"

Sylvia extended a champagne flute toward Evelyn with exaggerated cheer.

Evelyn glanced at the offered glass but made no move to accept it, letting the silence stretch uncomfortably.

Sylvia cleared her throat, masking her discomfort.

"Not drinking? No problem - I'll drink for both of us!" She downed the champagne in one gulp.

Evelyn's gaze remained icy. "A reunion? We weren't exactly friends, Sylvia."

The barb hit its mark. Sylvia rushed to apologize. "Evelyn, I was wrong before. I'm truly sorry."

Evelyn's laugh held no warmth. "If apologies fixed everything, we wouldn't need courts."

Sylvia's smile faltered. She'd humbled herself, yet Evelyn showed no mercy. Anger simmered beneath her carefully constructed calm.

"Evelyn, I've apologized. How much longer will you hold this grudge?"

The words tasted like ash in her mouth. Every second of this charade chipped away at her composure.

Evelyn's lips curved into a humorless smile.

"Amusing, Sylvia. Weren't you the one who orchestrated that little scene earlier with the waiter?"

Sylvia's face drained of color.

Evelyn continued, "And shall we revisit our history? I have quite the catalog of memories to choose from."

"Evelyn, I was foolish back then. Please, forgive me."

Another hollow laugh. "Forgiveness isn't automatic, Sylvia. Not after everything."

"Then what will it take?" Sylvia demanded, her mask of contrition slipping.

The air between them crackled with unspoken threats and long-buried grievances. Around them, the party continued unaware of the silent war raging between the two women.
###Chapter 333 Strike at the Heart

Evelyn's piercing gaze locked onto Sylvia, who instinctively recoiled under the intensity.

A direct strike to the core.

Evelyn understood exactly what mattered most to Sylvia.

With deliberate calmness, she delivered the blow. "It's time for a complete overhaul at Radiant Electronics. You should withdraw from the upcoming industry summit."

Sylvia's reaction was immediate. "Absolutely not—"

The words escaped before she could stop them. Radiant Electronics represented her family's last hope. Withdrawing from the summit would be catastrophic.

"Evelyn, I'll agree to anything but this."

Evelyn remained unmoved. "Voluntary withdrawal leaves room for recovery. Forced withdrawal after refusal... well, Radiant might not survive the consequences."

Sylvia's legs nearly gave way.

A wave of terror washed over her. She'd never imagined Evelyn could be this ruthless.

Regret flooded her, yet desperation made her try again. "Evelyn, Radiant is everything to my family. Don't do this."

"I'll apologize properly."

Evelyn walked away without acknowledgment, leaving Sylvia's pleas hanging in the air.

All strength drained from Sylvia's body. She collapsed to the floor as a cold breeze chilled her sweat-drenched back.

Evelyn showed no mercy!

"Ms. Carter is truly blessed - impeccable family background and extraordinary talent."

"In just six months leading Kingsley Industries, she's increased profits by 10%."

"For a multinational that size? The numbers are staggering."

"I envy Ms. Carter's business acumen."

The praise surrounding Evelyn made Sylvia's skin crawl. Watching Evelyn bask in admiration ignited unbearable jealousy.

She scoffed loudly. "She's riding on family connections! No real talent - just a pretty face."

"Ms. Montgomery, we're stating facts. What's your problem?"

"Clearly jealous. Ms. Carter has both beauty and brains."

"Weren't you two close earlier? Strange to hear such backstabbing now."

Mockery fueled Sylvia's rage. "Nonsense! Stop brown-nosing and show some dignity!"

To her, they were just sycophants.

"Evelyn and I were classmates. I know her limitations. Watch me prove it."

Curious glances followed her declaration.

"Inside information, Ms. Montgomery?"

Sylvia smirked. "Evelyn was the class dunce - terrible grades, zero social skills."

Disbelieving looks were exchanged.

"Don't believe me?" Sylvia ground her teeth. "I'll show you her true colors shortly."

Burning with humiliation, Sylvia resolved to make Evelyn share her misery.
###Chapter 334 Center Stage Spotlight

Evelyn adjusted her posture and strode confidently toward the wings of the stage.

The business summit's opening ceremony commenced moments later, with the charismatic host taking center stage, his voice brimming with infectious enthusiasm.

Within minutes, he had electrified the atmosphere, bringing the energy in the grand ballroom to a fever pitch.

"Among our distinguished guests tonight, we have the crème de la crème of the corporate world," the host announced. "As tradition dictates, we'll randomly select one visionary to share their leadership insights with us."

As the words left his mouth, Sylvia emerged from backstage, her venomous gaze locking onto Evelyn's position in the audience.

A sinister scheme was already taking shape in her mind.

She sauntered over to her clique of socialites, triumph flashing in her eyes. "Prepare yourselves, ladies. The real entertainment is about to begin."

The puzzled socialites exchanged glances. "Ms. Montgomery, don't overplay your hand," one cautioned.

Sylvia merely lifted her chin in defiance, refusing to dignify their concern with a response.

Her entire being thrummed with anticipation for Evelyn's impending humiliation.

Then the unexpected happened.

The host's gaze suddenly found Evelyn in the crowd. "Tonight we're honored to have among us the brilliant president of Kingsley Industries - Ms. Carter! Let's welcome Ms. Carter to share her corporate wisdom with us."

Evelyn's breath hitched at the unexpected summons.

Dominic hadn't mentioned this protocol during their briefing. Why was she being singled out?

Standing nearby, Dominic's expression darkened as he turned to his assistant. "What's the meaning of this?"

The equally baffled assistant responded, "I'll investigate immediately, Mr. Kingsley."

Dominic's gaze shifted to Evelyn, who maintained perfect composure, a serene smile playing on her lips.

"Never mind—"

Before Dominic could finish, the host continued, "Let's give Ms. Carter a warm welcome!"

Thunderous applause erupted as every eye in the room turned toward Evelyn.

Evelyn remained the picture of poise. Her sweeping gaze eventually landed on Sylvia.

The challenge in Sylvia's stare was unmistakable.

Their eyes locked in a silent battle of wills that lasted several heartbeats.

The socialites beside Sylvia shifted uncomfortably. "Aren't you being rather obvious with your hostility, Ms. Montgomery?" one whispered. "Aren't you afraid of the Kingsleys' retaliation?"

At that moment, fear was the furthest thing from Sylvia's mind.

"Even if they seek revenge," she said coldly, "it'll be after Evelyn's made a fool of herself. If I'm going down, I'm taking her with me."

The socialites exchanged worried glances. "You're playing with fire."

Sylvia ignored them, her focus entirely on Evelyn.

The tension between them was so palpable it seemed to vibrate through the air.

Yet Evelyn merely smiled and ascended the stage with effortless grace.

The room fell silent as she took the microphone. "Good evening everyone, I'm Evelyn Carter."

Her simple, unpretentious introduction radiated quiet confidence, instantly winning over the audience.

"Truth be told," she continued, "I consider myself still learning in the realm of executive leadership. My experience pales in comparison to many of you here tonight."
###Chapter 335 Dazzling Brilliance

The spotlight shifted to Evelyn Carter as she took the stage to share her management expertise.

Her delivery sparkled with wit and charm, striking the perfect balance between confidence and humility. Every word was measured, every pause deliberate.

What began as a simple ten-minute presentation held the entire audience captive. When she concluded, a stunned silence hung in the air before erupting into roaring applause.

"Ms. Carter is nothing short of a business prodigy!"

"Her strategic thinking is impeccable. No wonder Kingsley Industries has flourished under her leadership."

"At such a young age, she possesses remarkable business acumen. Truly inspirational!"

"I'd consider it a privilege to collaborate with Ms. Carter someday."

Sylvia Montgomery stood frozen amidst the praise, her plan backfiring spectacularly. Instead of catching Evelyn off guard, she'd only amplified her rival's spotlight.

How had this happened?

"Wait!" Sylvia's voice cut through the applause as Evelyn prepared to exit the stage.

Abandoning caution, she challenged, "Ms. Carter, I'd like to pose some questions if you don't mind."

Evelyn detected the hostility but remained composed. "Please," she gestured gracefully, "I welcome any questions."

Raised in business circles, Sylvia considered herself Evelyn's equal. She'd prepared particularly thorny questions designed to trip her up.

"In this economic downturn," Sylvia began, "with stock markets crashing and money markets destabilized, how would you prevent capital chain ruptures during such financial crises?"

Murmurs spread through the crowd. This was the million-dollar question plaguing every corporation.

Sylvia smirked, anticipating Evelyn's stumble.

Evelyn lifted the microphone, her voice clear and assured. "Financial leverage becomes our most valuable tool in these conditions..."

For five minutes, Evelyn outlined innovative leverage strategies, drawing admiring murmurs and nods from industry veterans.

Undeterred, Sylvia fired off increasingly complex questions. Each time, Evelyn parried with brilliant, well-reasoned responses.

By the end, several business titans openly praised Evelyn's expertise. As she stepped down, a crowd immediately surrounded her, seeking counsel.

Evelyn had become the undisputed star of the event.

"This...this can't be happening!" Sylvia seethed.

Never had she imagined Evelyn's skills would prove so formidable. Her attempt to humiliate Evelyn had only elevated her further.

"Ms. Montgomery, we should actually thank you," a socialite remarked with a smile. "Without your prompting, we might never have witnessed Ms. Carter's remarkable talents firsthand."

"I must tell my husband about this. A partnership with Kingsley Industries could be tremendously beneficial."
###Chapter 336 An Embarrassment

Sylvia Montgomery's nails dug into her palms until they left crescent-shaped marks. Yet she felt nothing.

Out of nowhere, Conrad Montgomery stormed toward his daughter.

The sharp sound of a slap echoed through the room. Sylvia's hand flew to her stinging cheek in shock. "Father, how could you hit me?"

Conrad's face was purple with rage.

Dominic Kingsley had already sent warnings about Sylvia deliberately causing trouble for Evelyn Carter.

"Do you think you're untouchable now?" Conrad hissed through clenched teeth. "What were my exact instructions before this event? And yet you provoked Ms. Carter?"

Sylvia cradled her burning face.

Never in her life had her doting father struck her - especially not in public over some nobody like Evelyn.

She kept her eyes downcast but seethed inwardly, blaming everything on Evelyn.

"You've jeopardized Montgomery Electronics!" Conrad spat, veins bulging at his temples. "Do you comprehend the damage you've caused?"

Sylvia bit her lip until she tasted blood.

Seeing her stubborn silence, Conrad snapped, "Get out of here before you humiliate us further."

Tears welled in Sylvia's eyes. "Father-"

"Not another word! Your accounts are frozen until we resolve this disaster."

Sylvia visibly deflated, but Conrad had already turned away, scanning the crowd for Evelyn to offer his groveling apology.

Evelyn stood encircled by eager business associates, leaving no breathing room.

When the last sycophant finally retreated, Evelyn collapsed onto a sofa with an exhausted sigh. Then she felt it - that prickling sensation of being watched.

Her sharp gaze swept across the room.

Nothing.

Had she imagined it?

The moment she looked away, a shadow detached itself from behind a pillar. Dark eyes burned into Evelyn's back, filled with turbulent emotions.

"Ms. Carter, you were magnificent!" Adrian Prescott materialized beside her, eyes shining with admiration.

Evelyn arched an eyebrow. "Mr. Prescott, Prescott Enterprises seems to be thriving under your leadership."

"I'd rather be at Kingsley Industries," Adrian confessed. "At least there I saw you daily."

Evelyn remained silent.

Adrian leaned closer. "The moment I returned, my father started badgering me about our families' old marriage arrangement."

He took her hand. "You're single now. Why not fulfill our parents' wishes?"

Evelyn extracted her hand with an awkward laugh. "Mr. Prescott, you'll regret this when you meet your true love."

Adrian's expression turned earnest. "Ms. Carter, my feelings for you are genuine. There's no one else I want."

Evelyn shook her head. What Adrian mistook for love was merely infatuation.

"Let's make a wager, Mr. Prescott."

Adrian's face lit up. "If I win, you'll marry me?"

"Is marriage all you think about?"
###Chapter 337 The Hidden Chamber

Adrian Prescott nodded eagerly. "Absolutely! Nothing else matters right now."

Evelyn Carter tilted her head with a knowing smile. "Though I suspect you'll be meeting your soulmate sooner than you think."

Adrian's eyes widened in shock. "You can't be serious, Evelyn."

"Don't you trust my intuition?" She arched one perfectly shaped eyebrow.

"It's not about trust." Adrian ran a hand through his hair, voice dropping to a murmur. "After knowing you, I doubt anyone else could make my pulse race like this."

He exhaled sharply, shoulders slumping. "But your happiness will always come first, Evelyn."

That single truth had driven him to walk away from Kingsley Industries without hesitation. Her joy meant more than his own shattered dreams.

Some sacrifices were worth making. Even when they left your heart in pieces.

###Chapter 338 Shadow Operations

The man emerged from the dimly lit room, his predatory gaze locking onto Evelyn the moment he saw her. "Well, well," he purred, circling her like a shark. "What rare beauty have we caught in our nets today?"

One of his associates recognized Evelyn and quickly whispered, "Damian, that's Mr. Prescott's guest."

Damian Castillo's smirk vanished at the mention of Adrian Prescott's name. His expression darkened as he advanced toward Evelyn. "What exactly did you see in there?" he demanded, his voice dropping to a dangerous whisper.

Evelyn met his gaze without flinching. "I saw enough to know your 'legitimate business' has a very dark underbelly. Those women didn't come here willingly, did they?"

Damian threw back his head and laughed, the sound devoid of any real humor. "Sharp little thing, aren't you?" His eyes turned glacial. "Pity you won't be leaving to tell anyone about it. A prize like you will fetch an excellent price."

With a snap of his fingers, his men moved to surround her.

Evelyn's lips curled in a cold smile. "You'll have to catch me first."

The moment the words left her mouth, three hulking figures lunged forward. Evelyn's eyes narrowed as she shifted into a defensive stance. Her leg shot out in a blur, connecting with precise brutality against their kneecaps.

The men stumbled back, howling in pain.

Damian's eyes gleamed with perverse excitement. "Oh, this one's got fight in her!" He cracked his knuckles and stepped forward himself.

His attacks came fast and vicious, forcing Evelyn on the defensive within seconds. But she spotted his tell - a slight favoring of his left side. Seizing her chance, she twisted and delivered a devastating kick between his legs.

The effect was immediate.

Damian doubled over, his face turning purple. "Get her!" he wheezed. "Don't let her escape!"

More men poured into the hallway. Evelyn knew she couldn't take them all. Spotting a gap, she bolted for the exit - only to find the steel door locked tight.

"Run all you want, sweetheart," Damian gasped, still clutching himself as his men closed in. "There's nowhere to go."

Evelyn's fingers brushed against the emergency transmitter hidden in her watch. "Human trafficking carries a life sentence," she said coldly. "You'll rot in prison for this."

Her words were met with raucous laughter. "In Frenda?" one thug sneered. "The law doesn't touch people like us. You're just another pretty face to be sold."

"Tie her up with the others," Damian ordered, finally straightening. "We move the shipment by boat at dawn."

Evelyn didn't resist as rough hands bound her wrists. She'd already decided - she wasn't just escaping. She was taking every one of those women with her.

They shoved her into a windowless room where frightened women huddled together. Most barely glanced up at her arrival, their spirits broken. But Evelyn's sharp eyes were already mapping the space.

The route she'd taken wound through hidden passages - cleverly concealed and soundproofed. No wonder no one outside heard the screams.

"Where are you all from?" Evelyn asked softly. Two women immediately burst into tears.

"Shhh," Evelyn soothed. "I'm getting you out of here."

Their hollow laughter cut deeper than any blade. "No one escapes," one whispered. "No one."
###Chapter 339 A Desperate Gamble

"We're being shipped out at dawn tomorrow. I may never see my family again."

"I can't die like this! Please, someone help us!"

The room fell into heavy silence, broken only by muffled sobs.

Evelyn Carter's hands clenched into fists, her nails biting into her palms. Even in this modern age, such barbaric practices still existed.

Her gaze swept across the dimly lit room.

Then she saw her - a girl who couldn't be older than eighteen, yet her eyes held the calm intensity of a seasoned warrior.

The girl stared back unflinchingly, her expression unreadable.

Neither spoke.

The silent standoff lasted thirty tense minutes.

Finally, the girl's voice cut through the darkness, laced with cautious hope. "Can you actually get us out?"

Evelyn didn't hesitate. "I will."

For a brief moment, hope flickered in the girl's eyes - then died when she noticed Evelyn's bound wrists.

Evelyn glanced down at the amateurish knots with contempt.

These amateurs couldn't tie their own shoelaces properly.

With practiced ease, she twisted her wrists and the ropes fell away.

Gasps filled the room.

"You...you're free!"

"How did you-"

Evelyn raised a finger to her lips. "Quiet!"

Understanding dawned on their faces. Even the weeping woman wiped her tears.

Without wasting words, Evelyn moved swiftly, freeing each captive with efficient movements.

The previously composed girl now looked at Evelyn with something akin to awe. "I'm Noelle Winslow. If we make it out, I'll find a way to repay you."

Evelyn gave a small smile and ruffled Noelle's hair. "We're getting out of here, Noelle. That's a promise."

Noelle nodded fiercely.

Evelyn gathered everyone close, whispering instructions like a seasoned general. No one questioned her authority.

Moments later, desperate screams erupted from the attic.

"Help! Someone's dying in here!"

"Please! We need a doctor!"

The coordinated cries soon drew their captors.

The door slammed open. "Shut your mouths unless you want to die tonight!"

One woman pointed frantically. "She's not breathing!"

As the guards rushed forward, Evelyn struck like a viper - her makeshift club connecting with a sickening crack.

One guard collapsed.

"Now! Run!"

The women didn't need telling twice. They surged toward freedom like a tidal wave.

But their hope was short-lived.

A wall of black-clad enforcers blocked their path.

"Foolish little mice," the leader sneered, cracking his whip. "Did you really think you could escape?"
###Chapter 340 A Thorned Lily

The women trembled at his words, their bodies instinctively recoiling. The memory of that whip's cruel bite was still fresh in their minds.

Damian Castillo stepped forward, his polished shoes clicking against the concrete floor.

His icy gaze swept over Evelyn Carter with clinical detachment. "Impressive. Ten minutes flat. You're faster than most."

Evelyn met his stare with equal frost, her voice cutting through the damp basement air. "Release us now, or I'll burn this entire operation to the ground."

Damian's laughter echoed off the walls as he slowly clapped. He couldn't deny her exotic beauty - those sharp cheekbones and piercing eyes would fetch a premium price. A rare flower indeed, but one with dangerous thorns.

"Dream on, sweetheart."

With a snap of his fingers, his enforcers moved in.

Then chaos erupted as a panicked underling burst through the door. "Boss! We're surrounded!"

Damian's face darkened. "Explain."

"It's the Kingsleys! Their private security has us locked down!"

The blood drained from Damian's face. "The Kingsley dynasty? We've never crossed paths. Why now?"

The subordinate shook violently. "They brought tactical teams, boss. Professional operators."

Damian's fist connected with the wall. "Goddamn it! There's only one reason they'd come after us."

His calculating gaze landed on Evelyn, realization dawning.

Her lips curled into a cold smile. "Oh, and the FBI's here too. Human trafficking carries a twenty-year minimum. Enjoy your new home."

Whispers of hope spread through the captive women.

Damian's knuckles turned white. "You think some suits with badges scare me? No one takes what's mine."

He barked orders. "Move them to the secondary location. Now!"

Another runner arrived, breathless. "Too late! The Kingsleys breached the perimeter. They're demanding their heiress."

Murmurs spread through Damian's crew. "Piss off the Kingsleys and we're finished in this city."

Damian paced like a caged animal. "Kingsley heiress? Point her out!"

He turned to the women. "Which one of you is Evelyn Kingsley? Speak up and walk free."

Silence.

Then Evelyn's voice cut through. "Everyone leaves. Now."

All eyes turned to her. Damian's expression shifted to sickening sweetness. "Ms. Kingsley, my deepest apologies for this... misunderstanding."
###Chapter 341 Rescuing the Captives

Evelyn's voice cut through the tension like ice. "Damian, release them."

Damian hesitated, his fingers twitching near his weapon. "As you wish, Ms. Carter." His bow was mocking.

Her glare intensified. "Are you deliberately misunderstanding me?"

Damian's smirk vanished. "Ms. Carter, I apologize for contradicting you." His voice turned wheedling. "But these women represent a significant investment. The financial loss would be-"

"Loss?" Evelyn's laugh held no humor. "You're still trying to negotiate when I'm giving you a chance to walk away alive."

A subordinate rushed in, panic in his eyes. "Boss! The Kingsley forces have the building surrounded. SWAT teams are moving in. We need to evacuate now!"

Damian's face paled. He turned back to Evelyn, defeat warring with fury in his expression. "Fine. Take them. But this isn't over, Ms. Carter."

With a sharp gesture, he signaled his men to abandon their posts. Within moments, only the frightened captives remained.

Dominic and Maxwell arrived within minutes, weapons drawn as they cleared each room. "Eve!" Dominic's voice cracked with barely restrained panic. "Are you hurt?"

She shook her head. "He got away, Dom."

Maxwell already had his comm unit out. "All units, suspect fleeing east in black SUV. License plate-"

"Dominic," Evelyn interrupted, "people like him create cracks in society's foundation. How many more will suffer if we don't stop this now?"

The police took statements while social workers helped the traumatized women contact their families. As Evelyn exited the precinct, a slight figure darted toward her.

"Ms. Carter," an officer explained, "Ms. Winslow refused to call anyone. Insisted on waiting for you."

Evelyn studied the trembling young woman. "Noelle, you're safe now. Why won't you go home?"

Noelle clutched Evelyn's sleeve like a lifeline. "Please...can I stay with you?" Her whisper was barely audible. "I...I ran away."

Evelyn's expression softened. "Whatever made you leave, facing it is safer than being out there alone."

Noelle's silence spoke volumes.

The precinct doors burst open as Adrian rushed in, his usually impeccable appearance disheveled. "Evelyn! When you left the VIP lounge, I thought you just needed air. Then the club got raided and-" His hands hovered over her shoulders, afraid to touch. "Are you alright?"

She offered a tired smile. "Still in one piece. See?"

Adrian's relieved exhale fogged his designer glasses. Behind them, Noelle's grip on Evelyn's arm tightened like she'd found her only anchor in a stormy sea.
###Chapter 342 Daughter of Elysium Banks Chairman

Seeing Evelyn safe, Adrian finally let out the breath he'd been holding. Just as he relaxed, his gaze landed on the girl standing beside her.

"Who's this?" he asked, curiosity flickering in his eyes.

Noelle glared at him sharply, her lips pressed into a thin line.

Adrian took a closer look at her then.

She was delicate, almost fragile. He reached out instinctively, ruffling her hair. "Don't worry. We'll find your family soon."

To his surprise, Noelle jerked away from his touch.

"Don't touch me!"

Adrian blinked, taken aback by her ferocity. "You're just a kid, aren't you?"

That seemed to ignite something in her. "I'm nineteen!"

Nineteen?

Adrian studied her again—petite frame, youthful features. But he didn't argue. "You shouldn't wander alone. The world's dangerous. Lucky for you, we found you first."

His voice dropped lower. "Traffickers would've sold you off or worse—harvested your organs."

Noelle's face paled, her hands clenched into fists.

Adrian frowned. "Hey, you okay? You look sick—"

Before he could finish, Noelle's knees buckled. He caught her just in time.

"Noelle? Wake up!"

No response. Panic rising, he rushed her to the hospital.

The examination revealed lash marks crisscrossing her back, the wounds raw and bleeding through her clothes.

Yet she hadn't made a single sound.

Adrian's hands shook with rage. "What kind of monsters would do this to a girl?"

Evelyn's voice was ice. "Traffickers deserve worse than prison. They deserve hell."

Her mind flashed to Damian Castillo, still at large. She'd make sure he paid.

Outside, a convoy of Bentleys pulled up.

A butler hurried to open the middle car's door.

"Mr. Winslow, she's inside."

Anthony Winslow stepped out, his expression unreadable. Bodyguards flanked him as he strode into the hospital.

The armed entourage told Evelyn everything—this man wasn't just wealthy. He was power personified.

Evelyn's breath hitched. "Do I know you?"

A business card appeared in the butler's hand, offered to her.

"Anthony Winslow."

The name sent a jolt through her. Then she read the card—and froze.
###Chapter 343 A Favor

"Are you Mr. Anthony Winslow, the chairman of Elysium Bank?"

Anthony's lips curved into a polite smile. "That would be me."

Adrian, standing nearby, suddenly connected the dots. His eyes widened slightly. "Mr. Winslow, are you and Noelle... related?"

Anthony's expression softened. "I'm Noelle's father."

The revelation hit Evelyn like a tidal wave. She hadn't expected the injured girl to be the daughter of Elysium Bank's powerful chairman.

"Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Winslow." Evelyn extended her hand, her posture radiating quiet confidence.

"My apologies," he said smoothly. "Old habits die hard."

"Perfectly understandable."

A favor from Elysium Bank's chairman carried more weight than any check—especially for someone in Evelyn's position.

"I'll remember that," Evelyn replied with a knowing smile that pleased Anthony.

It had been years since he'd encountered someone so refreshingly direct.

"Now if you'll excuse us, Mr. Winslow."

"Right this way, Ms. Carter."

Outside the hospital, Adrian's car idled at the curb. The drive back to Kingsley Manor passed in comfortable silence, the estate glowing like a beacon against the night sky.

###Chapter 344 A Miracle

With decades of life experience, he knew platonic friendships between men and women rarely existed.

###Chapter 345 An Invitation From the Winslow Family

###Chapter 346 Envy Towards Evelyn

###Chapter 347 The Enigmatic Stranger

###Chapter 348 You're Not Worthy

The crimson sports car had been swiftly immobilized by the security team.

###Chapter 349 Playful Banter

###Chapter 350 A Special Gift

###Chapter 352 Why Was There a Woman in Your Bed

###Chapter 353 Teaching Diana a Lesson
