"Must've been my imagination."

Though puzzled, Evelyn didn't press further.

As they crossed to the luxury hotel opposite, a crouching figure clutching a camera finally dared to breathe.

—

Wesley Fairfax waited dutifully at the hotel entrance per Matthias Thornton's instructions. Despite his rising fame as a content creator, he remained an employee at heart.

The boss's orders were law.

Spotting Evelyn and Harrison, Wesley hurried forward. "Ms. Carter, Mr. Whitmore! Mr. Thornton is already upstairs."

"Then let's not keep him waiting."

Wesley ushered them inside, even pressing the elevator button with practiced efficiency. None noticed the camera lens capturing their every move.

—

In the penthouse suite, Matthias Thornton gestured to his assistant, who produced sleek portfolios. "Mr. Whitmore, Ms. Carter - these highlight Byte Technologies' most successful short video initiatives. Please review."

The assistant presented the documents with both hands.

Evelyn opened hers with genuine interest.

Though new to digital content creation, the palpable excitement surrounding this industry convinced her of its potential.

Wesley eagerly explained the basics.

"Ms. Carter, you could create a Byte account to share snippets of your life. I've had one for months, though I've never posted."

"Consistency is key. Regular uploads trigger the algorithm to push your content."

"When viewers engage longer, the system amplifies your reach exponentially. That's how unknown creators suddenly go viral."

Evelyn nodded thoughtfully.

"Once you build substantial followers, you can monetize through live-stream shopping."

Matthias interjected with visible pride.

"Don't underestimate live commerce, Ms. Carter. During our last mega sale, Wesley here generated $200M in gross merchandise volume during a single eight-hour stream."

Two hundred million? From one broadcast?

The staggering figure made Evelyn's eyebrows climb.

"Naturally, only top-tier creators achieve those numbers. But even mid-level influencers regularly clear six figures per session."

Evelyn's lips parted slightly. Traditional businesses might need quarters to achieve what digital creators accomplished in hours.

The realization struck like lightning - this wasn't just an emerging industry.

This was a gold rush.
###Chapter 435 Rough Outline

Two hours slipped by before their discussion with Matthias concluded.

As they stepped out of the hotel, Matthias still wore a hint of reluctance. "Ms. Carter, Mr. Whitmore, if Kingsley Industries ever considers collaborating with Byte, my door is always open."

"Of course, Mr. Thornton. Let's wrap things up for today."

"Certainly, Mr. Whitmore, Ms. Carter. Goodbye."

Once Matthias was out of earshot, Evelyn turned to Harrison, her gaze heavy with unspoken thoughts.

But before she could voice them, Harrison already knew. His voice was soft. "Thinking about diving into the media industry?"

A smile tugged at Evelyn's lips as she nodded. "It's still emerging, but the potential is massive. Kingsley Industries could test the waters—launch an artist division, scout promising streamers, build an operations team, and create an account..."

Her enthusiasm spilled over as she spoke, her mind already sketching a rough blueprint.

Finally, she couldn't resist asking, "Harrison, what do you think?"

"It's solid. Ready for execution."

Evelyn beamed, satisfaction lighting up her face. "Then we'll present it at the board meeting next Monday. If half the executives approve, we move forward immediately."

She had found a new spark. Back at home, she worked tirelessly for days, refining a detailed feasibility plan for the company's expansion.

Monday arrived swiftly. Despite the sleepless nights, Evelyn strode into Kingsley Industries at 9:00 AM, energy crackling around her like static.

"Ms. Carter, the board members are all here. They're waiting for you to begin," Maxwell murmured, keeping pace beside her.

Evelyn gave a quiet hum. "I'll head in now."

The conference room buzzed with rare liveliness.

The company's top brass had clearly caught wind of something big—everyone had arrived punctually.

Even Julian, who seldom attended executive meetings, had shown up. The significance of this gathering was undeniable.

"It's almost 9:00. Where is Ms. Carter?"

"Even Mr. Kingsley never kept us waiting like this."

"Someone should check when she's arriving."

Murmurs of impatience rippled through the room.

Then, the door swung open. Maxwell stepped aside, and Evelyn entered with a composed smile.

Instant silence.

Reaching the head of the table, she spoke with polished courtesy. "My apologies for the delay."

The executives' irritation dissolved under her calm authority. No one dared to protest.

Evelyn swept a glance across the room before taking her seat.

At that moment, Maxwell distributed the freshly printed documents.

"Everyone, what you're holding is the feasibility plan for Kingsley Industries' new venture in the latter half of the year."

"Today's meeting marks the first discussion on this project. Feel free to raise any questions. Afterward, we'll proceed to a vote."

With that, the executives flipped open their files.

One by one, surprise flickered across their faces. Hushed exchanges broke out.

"Ms. Carter, what is this?" someone finally asked. "Is Kingsley Industries venturing into short-form video?"
###Chapter 436 The Unexpected Move

Evelyn Carter gave a firm nod, her voice clear as crystal. "In today's digital age, short-form video platforms are exploding in popularity."

She tapped the presentation screen for emphasis. "While Kingsley Industries hasn't ventured into this space before, this represents a golden opportunity for diversification—"

Before she could finish, Julian Hawthorne slammed his folder onto the mahogany conference table with a loud thud.

"I strongly object, Ms. Carter."

The abrupt interruption sent murmurs rippling through the boardroom.

Evelyn arched an eyebrow. "Do you have concerns, Director Hawthorne?"

Julian's lips curled into a mocking smile. "Kingsley has built its reputation on cutting-edge technology - quantum computing, biomedical innovations, rare earth extraction."

He leaned forward, his gold cufflinks glinting. "These are our specialties. Our proven successes. And now you want us to gamble on some fleeting social media trend?" His gaze sharpened. "Tell me, Ms. Carter, what's your success rate projection?"

His words ignited a chorus of agreement. "Director Hawthorne makes a valid point," chimed in another board member. "Diversifying into unfamiliar territory could damage our brand credibility."

"Perhaps reconsider this impulsive decision," added a silver-haired woman, adjusting her glasses. "The media sector is notoriously volatile."

A heavyset man in an expensive suit interjected, "If we're discussing investments, commercial real estate shows far more stability. The new downtown development zone—"

The debate grew heated, opinions clashing like waves against rocks.

Julian lounged back in his chair, the picture of smug satisfaction, watching the dissent spread.

When the arguments reached their peak, he delivered his final blow. "Ms. Carter, the board has spoken. Stick to what we know. That property development proposal sounds far more promising than chasing internet fads."

All eyes turned to Evelyn, anticipating her retreat.

But the young CEO remained unshaken, her composure steel.

She steepled her fingers. "Since real estate seems to be the popular choice, let me ask this: Are we building homes or speculating on property bubbles?"

Her question struck like a lightning bolt.

Government regulations were tightening around the housing market - everyone knew this, though some chose willful ignorance.

"Ms. Carter, property will always hold value," argued one director.

"Land is the safest long-term investment," insisted another.

"Why take unnecessary risks when we have proven business models?"

The resistance was palpable, the fear of change thick in the air.

Julian's smirk widened. This should be good.

Then Evelyn did something unexpected.

She laughed.

A rich, confident sound that silenced the room.

"Who said we'd be starting from scratch?"

The board members exchanged confused glances.

At that precise moment, the conference room doors swung open.
###Chapter 437 Reassurance

The conference room doors swung open dramatically.

Julian Hartwell strode in, his tailored navy suit accentuating his broad shoulders. His agent followed half a step behind. The collective gasp from the board members was audible.

"Why is Julian Hartwell here?"

Murmurs spread like wildfire. The youngest Kingsley brother was a global superstar with a social media following that could crash servers with a single post. His presence here made no sense.

Samuel Walker's face darkened instantly. His fingers tightened around his pen until his knuckles turned white. This wasn't part of the plan.

Julian moved with effortless grace toward Evelyn Carter. Their shared smile spoke volumes. The warmth in his eyes when he looked at his sister was unmistakable.

"Julian."

He acknowledged her with a subtle nod before turning to address the room. "Good afternoon, everyone." His voice carried the smooth confidence of someone used to commanding attention.

One of the senior executives couldn't contain his curiosity. "Mr. Hartwell, with all due respect, you've never shown interest in Kingsley Industries' affairs before. What brings you here today?"

Julian's lips quirked. "Excellent question. I understand Kingsley is launching an entertainment division today." He paused for effect. "Consider me your first signed artist."

The room erupted.

Julian Hartwell wasn't just any celebrity. He was a triple threat - actor, singer, and producer with box office records to his name. His endorsement alone could make or break brands.

"You can't be serious."

"Deadly serious." Julian shrugged. "I've maintained creative control over my career until now. Signing with Kingsley represents a strategic shift for me." His gaze swept the room. "Assuming, of course, the division gets approved today."

The implication hung heavy in the air.

Julian hadn't come to join Kingsley Industries. He'd come to back Evelyn's bold new venture into digital media.

With his star power behind it, the new division wouldn't just succeed - it would dominate.

The mood in the room shifted palpably.

"This media initiative shows remarkable foresight. Digital content is where the market's heading."

"We'd be fools not to capitalize on this emerging sector."

"Traditional models are becoming obsolete. This is exactly the kind of innovation we need."

"Ms. Carter's proposal has my full support. With Mr. Hartwell onboard, success is practically guaranteed."

Samuel's face flushed crimson with suppressed rage. His carefully laid plans were unraveling before his eyes.

Evelyn had played her trump card - and it was a royal flush. Julian's surprise appearance hadn't just swayed the board; it had cemented her position beyond challenge.
###Chapter 438 The Tides Turn

The atmosphere in the boardroom shifted instantly.

One by one, the executives began nodding in agreement with Evelyn's proposal.

"Mr. Hawthorne, what's your stance on this matter?" Evelyn turned her piercing gaze toward Julian.

Julian forced a tight-lipped smile, his fingers drumming nervously on the table. "Given the overwhelming support for your proposal, Ms. Carter, I can hardly object. The talent division seems like a sound investment."

Evelyn's lips curved in satisfaction. "Excellent. Let's proceed with a formal vote then."

Glances were exchanged across the mahogany table before hands started rising in unanimous approval.

Even Julian couldn't resist adding some levity. "As a minor shareholder of Kingsley Industries, I believe my vote counts as well." With a dramatic flourish, he raised his hand.

The final tally exceeded all expectations.

Evelyn beamed. "With more than two-thirds majority approval, the talent division is officially approved. Kingsley Industries enters a new era today."

Applause erupted through the conference room.

As attendees filed out, Julian caught Evelyn's arm playfully. "So, Evie, how'd I do?" His eyes sparkled with mischief.

Evelyn gave him an appreciative smile. "Brilliantly. You silenced those stuffy old board members. Without you, this never would've passed so smoothly."

"Does that make me your knight in shining armor?"

Laughing, Evelyn linked arms with him. "Absolutely. But Julian, are you truly serious about signing your management contract with us?"

He tapped her forehead affectionately. "Do I ever joke about business matters?"

Evelyn rubbed her head in mock protest. "Ouch! Though I suppose it's worth the pain."

"You ridiculous girl. Just remember - I expect VIP treatment. After all, I'm currently your only A-list artist."

"Of course!" Evelyn nodded vigorously. "You'll be our crown jewel. Every resource at our disposal will be dedicated to you. The entire company will revolve around your career."

Julian chuckled, feigning reluctance. "Well, if I'm going to be this spoiled, I suppose I can't refuse."

"Thank you, Julian."

"Don't be silly. Being needed by you... it's rather flattering actually."

For Julian, this was simply business - but helping Evelyn in the process made it all the sweeter.

Meanwhile, across town, Juliette and Eleanor were poring over freshly developed photographs.

"Are these all we have?" Juliette flipped through the stack with a frown. "The quality is decent, but they're not particularly damning."

Harrison's presence in several shots complicated matters - clearly indicating Evelyn and Wesley hadn't been alone at the hotel.

The situation wasn't nearly as scandalous as they'd hoped.

Eleanor wrung her hands. "Was this entire operation pointless?"

Just then, Juliette's fingers stilled on one particular shot - a perfectly framed image of Evelyn and Wesley that, at first glance, appeared quite intimate.

A slow smile spread across Juliette's face. "Pointless? Hardly, Mrs. Blackwell."
###Chapter 439 Unexpected Twist

Juliette Blackwood waved the photograph triumphantly. "This single image is enough to destroy Evelyn Carter's reputation completely."

Eleanor Blackwell examined the photo with a satisfied smirk. "In that case, let's watch Evelyn burn. I want to see how those mindless fans tear her apart."

"Don't worry, I'll contact the media immediately. By tonight, this picture will be trending across every social platform!"

Eleanor gave a cold laugh. "Perfect."

True to their word, a series of compromising photos began circulating online that afternoon.

The images exploded across the internet like wildfire.

"Streamer's Secret Affair With Billionaire Heiress" - the sensational headline dominated trending lists within hours, igniting a social media firestorm.

"Oh my God! Is this real? Wesley Fairfax is dating Evelyn Carter from the Kingsley family?"

"What's happening here? A Kingsley heiress involved with a gaming streamer?"

"Wesley hit the jackpot! The Kingsley fortune is worth billions!"

"Wait... my future husband is dating Evelyn Carter?"

"They're both single adults. What's the problem?"

"Honestly... if it were anyone else I'd be jealous. But Evelyn Carter? She's such a worthy opponent. I can only give them my blessing."

"Same here! They make a perfect couple!"

"Agreed!"

"My full support!"

Natalie Reeves was speechless.

As a seasoned publicist, Natalie was among the first to spot the trending story. At first, she thought her eyes were deceiving her. She'd even rubbed them and refreshed her feed repeatedly.

But when she confirmed the woman in the photos was indeed Evelyn, panic set in. She immediately dialed Evelyn's number.

"Evelyn, what's going on with these photos circulating online?"

Evelyn sounded genuinely confused. "What photos?"

Natalie kept it brief. "You need to see this yourself. Someone leaked photos of you and Wesley Fairfax meeting privately. It's everywhere."

Evelyn's breath hitched.

Private meeting with Wesley? When had that ever happened?

Evelyn quickly opened Twitter. Sure enough, her name and Wesley's topped the trending list.

She clicked through to find photos from that night at the hotel with Harrison Whitmore - except Harrison had been conveniently cropped out, leaving only her and Wesley in frame.

The photographer had chosen angles masterfully. To any casual observer, the images suggested an intimate relationship between them.

"Did you see them? What's going on?" Natalie's concerned voice came through the speaker.

Evelyn sighed in frustration. "It's all a misunderstanding! I wasn't alone with Wesley. Harrison Whitmore and Matthias Thornton from Byte Technologies were both there. We were discussing a business collaboration."

Understanding dawned on Natalie. "So you've been set up. This is sloppy work, but the public reaction is... unexpected."

Evelyn scrolled through the comments, her eyebrows rising in astonishment.

A popular streamer like Wesley should have legions of protective fans. Yet instead of attacking her, they were unanimously supporting the supposed relationship.

"I don't understand this either," Evelyn admitted helplessly.
###Chapter 440 Unfazed by the Spotlight

Evelyn Carter tapped her manicured nails against the marble countertop. "If we let this rumor continue circulating, won't it essentially confirm my supposed relationship with Wesley?"

Her phone buzzed with an incoming message.

The screen illuminated her suddenly stormy expression.

Natalie Reeves leaned forward. "If you don't issue a denial, the public will take this as confirmation of your involvement with Wesley. But honestly..." A sly smile curved her lips. "This could work in your favor."

She gestured excitedly. "You're launching your new lifestyle brand next month! This viral moment could give you incredible exposure—"

"Absolutely not." Evelyn's refusal came sharp as shattered glass.

Her gaze remained locked on Wesley's text—nearly identical to Natalie's suggestion. As a digital creator, Wesley understood the value of capitalizing on trending topics. Their "scandal" had exploded across every platform, and while they barely knew each other, riding this wave seemed like smart business to him.

But Evelyn had other priorities. "Natalie, draft a statement. I want this shut down in ten minutes."

Natalie's eyebrows shot up. "Someone's worried about Harrison getting the wrong idea."

A soft hum of confirmation.

"Damn, Evie." Natalie whistled. "You're really passing up this golden opportunity just to avoid upsetting your man?"

In an era where influencers would stage car crashes for clout, Evelyn's refusal to exploit the situation was practically revolutionary.

Natalie's fingers flew across her tablet. "Honestly? I respect it. No relationship is worth compromising for cheap publicity." She paused, frown deepening. "Wait... these photos weren't leaked. This was orchestrated."

The telltale signs were everywhere—the strategic cropping, the coordinated posting times, the army of suspiciously similar fan accounts. As a PR expert, Natalie recognized a media play when she saw one.

"We need to find out who's pulling the strings."

—

Juliette Blackwood's phone nearly cracked under her grip.

She and Eleanor had expected Evelyn to be torn apart by Wesley's rabid fanbase. Instead, 80% of the comments were shipping the "adorable power couple."

"Are these people blind?" Juliette shrieked. "She must be paying for bots! There's no way—"

Eleanor's hands trembled. "This backfired spectacularly. And if Nathan finds out we—"

A chill ran down her spine. The consequences didn't bear thinking about.
###Chapter 441 The Tables Turned

Juliette moved closer and grasped Eleanor's trembling hand. "Relax. This stays between us. Nathan will never discover your involvement as long as I remain silent."

Eleanor's breath came in shallow gasps. She knew how protective Nathan was of Evelyn - he'd explicitly warned her multiple times against provoking his wife.

But this time, she'd gone too far.

"Juliette, you must swear to keep this secret!"

The designer smiled knowingly. "Madam Blackwell, the photographer's payment came from my personal account. Even if Nathan investigates, the trail leads only to me."

Eleanor clutched her pearls as relief washed over her.

"Excellent. That's perfect."

"However..."

Juliette hesitated dramatically. "You did promise to help with that waterfront property transfer."

"That's nothing, darling." Eleanor waved a dismissive hand. "Consider it done."

Juliette's smile widened as she linked arms with the older woman. "You're too kind, Madam Blackwell!"

Eleanor exhaled sharply. Compared to Nathan discovering she'd orchestrated Evelyn's paparazzi scandal, a simple land transfer seemed trivial.

——

Evelyn issued a personal statement debunking the rumors with Wesley.

She supplemented it with hotel surveillance footage clearly showing four individuals entering and exiting the suite.

The public quickly realized their mistake.

"What a letdown! I was shipping them so hard."
"Wesley deserves a queen, not workplace rumors."
"Honestly though, Ms. Carter and Wesley would make a stunning couple. Someone make this happen!"
"Are you blind? That man beside Ms. Carter is clearly her equal. Look at how he carries himself!"
"Right? That mysterious hottie could be Hollywood royalty. The way they stand together..."
"Do we finally have confirmation about Ms. Carter's mystery man?"
"The people demand answers!"

Public interest skyrocketed, shifting focus entirely to Evelyn and Harrison.

Even Natalie seemed surprised.

"Talk about a plot twist! Evelyn, you and Harrison look positively married in that blurry shot. The internet's obsessed."

Evelyn skimmed the comments with mild amusement. "As long as they're not harassing Wesley, I don't care."

"Wow, playing favorites much?" Natalie teased, genuinely pleased to see her friend moving forward.

The shadows of Evelyn's past finally seemed to be fading. This was the fresh start she deserved.
###Chapter 442 Out of Reach

"I did some digging, and it seems someone paid to spread those vicious rumors about you and Wesley."

"Any idea who's behind it?"

"Not yet, but I'll find out who dared to pull such a low move."

Natalie's voice was firm, then she added playfully, "Though I have to say, the public isn't completely clueless. At least they focused on the right details."

"By the way, Evelyn, why don't we invite Harrison for drinks tonight?"

Evelyn thought it was a great idea. "Sure, I'll text him."

She opened her chat with Harrison. Their conversation had gone silent since last night, and unease flickered in her eyes.

They had been texting daily without fail—until now. The longest gap before had been mere hours. But today was different.

A full night had passed without a reply.

Her fingers flew across the screen as she sent another message.

She waited. One minute. Five. Ten. Half an hour ticked by.

Still nothing.

"Natalie, is it normal for someone who usually replies instantly to just... disappear?"

Natalie raised an eyebrow, glancing at Evelyn's phone. "Wait, Harrison hasn't responded yet?"

Evelyn nodded, her stomach twisting with unease.

"It's fine. I'll just call him."

She dialed his number.

The robotic voice on the other end made her freeze. "The number you have dialed is currently unavailable."

"Unavailable?"

Natalie quickly reassured her. "Don't panic. He's probably tied up with something. Don't overthink it."

Evelyn hummed, trying to convince herself Natalie was right.

"I'll try again tonight."

Natalie sighed. "Love really changes you. Relax! Harrison isn't going anywhere. He'll reply the second he sees your message."

"I hope so."

Hearing Evelyn's dejection, Natalie suggested, "Since Harrison's busy, let's invite Olivia instead. The three of us can still have fun."

"Okay."

—

That evening, the trio gathered.

But Evelyn was distracted. Her phone had been silent all afternoon.

Not a single notification.

She stood abruptly. "You two go ahead. I need to check on something."

Natalie and Olivia exchanged glances, but Evelyn was already out the door.

She drove straight to Horizon Technologies.

The offices were closed. Evelyn approached a security guard. "Excuse me, has Mr. Whitmore been in today?"

The guard eyed her skeptically. Women showing up asking about Harrison wasn't unusual. Today alone, there'd been at least half a dozen.

He'd long since stopped being surprised.
###Chapter 443 An Unexpected Encounter

The security guard gave a polite but firm response. "I'm not privy to Mr. Whitmore's personal affairs. But miss, let me warn you - Mr. Whitmore isn't someone to be taken lightly. I'd advise against getting any ideas about him."

Evelyn stood speechless.

Just as she was about to respond, the sharp honk of a car horn interrupted her thoughts.

Turning around, Evelyn spotted Nathan's sleek black Mercedes parked at the curb. The door swung open and he emerged, his long strides carrying him toward her with purpose.

"Evelyn? What brings you here?" His deep voice held a note of surprise.

"That's my line," she countered smoothly.

Nathan had been driving past when he caught sight of her familiar silhouette. His gaze lifted to the gleaming sign above them - "Horizon Technologies" - and something dark flickered in his eyes.

"Are you here to see Harrison?" The question came out sharper than intended, jealousy coloring his tone as he searched her face for answers.

But Evelyn remained impassive. "Mr. Sterling, that's my personal business and none of your concern."

One sentence. That's all it took to draw an unmistakable line between them.

Undeterred, Nathan pressed on. "It's getting late. Let me drive you home - it's not safe for you to be out alone."

Evelyn instinctively shook her head, jingling her car keys. "No need. I have my own transportation."

She turned toward her vehicle, but Nathan caught up in two quick strides.

"Evelyn, do you despise me that much?"

A careless smile played on her lips. "Mr. Sterling, you're imagining things. I simply don't wish to inconvenience you."

With that final dismissal, she walked away without looking back.

Nathan stood rooted to the spot, watching until her taillights disappeared around the corner.

Moments later, his phone buzzed violently in his pocket. The call lasted less than a minute, but by the time he hung up, his expression had turned thunderous.

"I'll handle this personally."

The twenty-minute drive to Sterling Manor took him eight. Tires screeched as he pulled into the circular driveway.

"Mr. Sterling, you're home!" A flustered housekeeper rushed to greet him.

"Where's my mother?" The ice in his voice made the woman shrink back.

"Madam is... upstairs."

Nathan stormed past without another word.

Upstairs, Eleanor heard the commotion below. She stepped out of her suite just as Nathan reached the landing.

"Nathan! You're back early. Have you eaten? I'll have the kitchen—"

"Save it." The words cut through her greeting like a knife.

Eleanor froze, suddenly aware of the dangerous energy radiating from her son.

"Well... if you're not hungry, you should rest. It's been a long day." She turned to retreat to her room.

"Wait!"

The single word stopped her cold. A shiver ran down Eleanor's spine.

"Y-yes? Was there something else?" Her voice trembled.
###Chapter 444 I Am Your Mother

Nathan's piercing gaze locked onto Eleanor as he demanded in an icy tone, "Mother, is there nothing you wish to confess to me?"

Eleanor staggered backward, her manicured fingers clutching the banister for support.

"I... I don't understand what you mean," she stammered, her voice trembling.

Nathan advanced with predatory grace, cornering her against the wall. "Do you truly not comprehend the gravity of your actions?"

"You know?" Eleanor's entire body shook as she squeezed her eyes shut, consumed by terror.

"It... it wasn't intentional! That insufferable Evelyn kept flaunting herself. I merely wanted to put her in her place."

Nathan's hand shot out like lightning, gripping her wrist. "What did you just say? What have you done to Evelyn?"

Eleanor blinked in confusion. "Isn't this what you were referring to?"

A humorless laugh escaped Nathan as he released her arm. "It appears you've been keeping far more secrets than I imagined."

"No! Nathan, please listen—"

"Enough!" His voice cracked like a whip. "I've warned you repeatedly not to provoke Evelyn."

Terror gripped Eleanor as she desperately clung to his sleeve. "I made a mistake! Give me another chance—I swear I won't—"

Nathan peeled her fingers away one by one, his expression glacial. "Effective immediately, all your credit cards will be frozen. You'll receive nothing beyond basic living expenses."

"You can't do this! How will I survive?"

Eleanor's extravagant lifestyle had left her unprepared for financial restrictions. The thought of budgeting made her physically ill.

"I'm your mother! Blood should come before some outsider like Evelyn!" She clung to him like a drowning woman, until an authoritative voice cut through the tension.

"No true mother would behave as you have!"

Margaret stood framed in the doorway, her regal presence commanding immediate respect.

"Grandmother." Nathan's demeanor softened noticeably. He'd always held deep reverence for the family matriarch.

Margaret nodded before turning her disapproving gaze on Eleanor. "You've acted foolishly, daughter."

"Mother, please! Intercede for me!" Eleanor begged, dropping to her knees. "Make Nathan see reason!"

Margaret sighed heavily. "For three years, Evelyn devoted herself to our family. Tell me, what daughter-in-law could compare?"

"But you and Vanessa constantly made her life difficult at every turn."

"I only thought her unworthy of our name! I wanted to protect Nathan's future—"

"And now?" Margaret arched a silver eyebrow.

Eleanor hung her head in shame. With Evelyn's true identity revealed, she knew the young woman was the ideal match for Nathan.

Yet her wounded pride had driven her to petty vengeance.

"Mother, she's already divorced Nathan."

Margaret's cane struck the marble floor with a sharp crack. "How dare you! Had you shown her basic kindness, their marriage might have survived."
###Chapter 445 Hollow Apologies

Eleanor stood frozen, her lips trembling under Margaret's stern gaze.

"You show no remorse. Instead, you're digging yourself deeper. You've single-handedly destroyed any chance they had."

Margaret's voice carried decades of disappointment as she turned to Nathan. "Do what you must, my boy. I stand with you. Your mother was wrong. But blood remains blood. Remember your manners."

The matriarch's sigh seemed to age her ten years before their eyes.

"Grandmother—"

Margaret silenced him with a raised hand, her retreating figure unusually frail.

Nathan's glacial stare pinned Eleanor in place.

"I know I've made mistakes," Eleanor whispered, twisting her hands. "I see that now."

The silence stretched like barbed wire between them.

"That land purchase for Juliette," Nathan finally spoke, each word sharp as shattered glass. "Did you use the Sterling name?"

Eleanor's breath hitched. Understanding dawned slowly. "Is that why you came today?"

Nathan ignored her question. "Do you even know who Juliette Blackwood truly is?"

When he leaned close to whisper those damning words, Eleanor collapsed like a marionette with cut strings.

Nathan didn't glance back as he strode away, leaving his mother sprawled on the marble floor.

Her anguished wails echoed through the grand foyer. "Impossible! This can't be happening!"

A butler materialized at her side. "Madam Blackwell, Mr. Sterling requests your immediate packing. The jet awaits to take you to Astana."

Eleanor scrambled backward. "No! Not Astana! I won't go back to that cursed place!"

Below, Nathan stood immobile in the courtyard, Eleanor's screams washing over him like rain against stone. His phone was already at his ear.

"Simon. I need you."

"At your service, Mr. Sterling."

"Pull all transaction records between Eleanor Blackwell and Juliette Blackwood. Every hidden account, every shell company."

A sharp inhale. "Sir, you're asking me to investigate Madam Sterling's private—"

"Email the findings directly to me." The call ended with finality.

Nathan took one last look at the gilded cage he'd called home before walking away without hesitation.

Dawn found Nathan slumped in his car, the ashtray overflowing. His bloodshot eyes tracked movement through the tinted windows.

Juliette's surprised gasp carried through the morning air as he emerged from the vehicle.

"Nathan? What are you—"

"Where are you headed so early?" His voice roughened by smoke and sleeplessness.

Juliette's smile turned feline. "Sterling Enterprises finally secured that waterfront parcel. Off to sign the paperwork." She tilted her head. "Since when do you care about my schedule?"
###Chapter 446 Were Even

Nathan gave a slight nod, his voice cool and detached. "Diana, the real estate market is unstable right now. Major policy changes are coming. Your impulsive investment could leave you financially stranded."

Juliette's lips curved into a wider smile, though her eyes remained icy.

She tilted her head mockingly. "Nathan, is this really about the market? Or are you just protecting Evelyn? Afraid I'll build Sterling Enterprises into something that could rival Kingsley Industries?"

His expression didn't flicker. "You could never be her equal."

Juliette's face darkened, but before she could retort, Nathan produced a thick folder from his briefcase.

"At least she doesn't resort to petty schemes like you."

He shoved the documents across the table, the sharp edge catching her wrist. She winced.

"The leaked photos. The online smear campaign. All your doing, wasn't it?"

Juliette hadn't expected him to uncover her involvement so quickly, but she maintained her composure.

She knew he wouldn't act against her - not with Eleanor's influence protecting her.

"Did you come here just to accuse me? Fine, I did it. But Eleanor was involved too. Would the great Nathan Sterling really go against his own family for a woman?"

Nathan's eyes darkened dangerously. The silence stretched between them.

Juliette scoffed and gathered her purse. "Since you won't do anything, don't waste my time. I have government officials waiting to finalize our contract."

As she turned to leave, Nathan's voice stopped her cold.

"Eleanor may have secured that land deal for you." His lips curled into a humorless smile. "But I can make it disappear just as easily. Don't you think?"

Panic flashed across Juliette's face. "Nathan, we've known each other for years. Must you be so cruel?"

He shook his head, almost regretful. "I came to warn you as a courtesy. But you're determined to ignore reason. Consider the Blackwell family's debt to the Delaneys repaid. We're even now."

"Nathan!"

He was already walking away. "Think carefully about your next moves, Ms. Delaney."

Juliette watched his retreating figure, her nails digging into her palms. She refused to believe his warnings - convinced this was just another ploy to protect Evelyn.

"You'll regret this," she hissed under her breath. "I'll make sure Evelyn Carter crawls at my feet!"

Evelyn woke with a start, sneezing violently several times in succession. Rubbing her nose, she checked her temperature.

"No fever," she murmured. "Must be allergies."

Marien appeared in the doorway, concern etching her features. "Ms. Carter, are you unwell?"

Evelyn waved her off. "Just the season changing. Nothing serious."

"Let me prepare some ginger tea for you."

After Marien left, Evelyn reached for her phone. The screen remained stubbornly blank - no new messages. A familiar ache settled in her chest as she stared at the empty notification panel.
###Chapter 447 She Barely Knows Him

Evelyn's fingers hovered over her phone screen, lost in thought.

"Ms. Carter, your ginger tea is ready. It's best when hot."

Britley's voice snapped Evelyn back to reality. She straightened her posture. "Just set it there, thank you."

"Of course."

As Britley turned to leave, Evelyn suddenly spoke. "Britley... if someone suddenly becomes unreachable, could it mean something's wrong?"

The experienced housekeeper took one look at Evelyn's troubled expression and understood immediately. "Ms. Evelyn, this is about Mr. Whitmore, isn't it?"

Heat rushed to Evelyn's cheeks at being so transparent.

"Britley, you—"

The older woman smiled knowingly. "You've mentioned Mr. Whitmore several times this week. Even an old woman like me couldn't miss it."

Evelyn's blush deepened. "That's not what I meant!"

Britley patted her hand reassuringly. "Don't worry, dear. If Mr. Whitmore hasn't contacted you, he's likely occupied with business. He'll reach out when he can."

"You really think so?"

The uncertainty in Evelyn's voice surprised even herself. She hadn't realized how much Harrison's silence affected her.

"Absolutely, Ms. Evelyn. Don't dwell on it. The car will arrive shortly to take you to the office."

Evelyn nodded, some tension leaving her shoulders. "Thank you, Britley."

With a final smile, Britley exited. Evelyn rose from bed and scrolled through her contacts, searching for anyone who might have information about Harrison.

Her fingers stilled. A realization struck her - she knew disturbingly little about the man who'd occupied her thoughts all morning.

Evelyn struggled to focus during her morning meetings.

Maxwell cleared his throat. "Ms. Carter? Your thoughts on this proposal? How should we proceed?"

She blinked. "Pardon?"

Adjusting his glasses, Maxwell handed her the documents. "You seem distracted today."

Evelyn flipped through the pages, schooling her expression. "Nonsense."

Maxwell saw right through her. "Is something troubling you?"

"Nothing at all! Let's proceed with the project as planned." She signed the documents with practiced efficiency.

"Understood, Ms. Carter."

After Maxwell left, Evelyn stood by the floor-to-ceiling windows, taking a steadying breath. The office door swung open again.

"Maxwell, was there something else?"

Julian arched an eyebrow. "Not Maxwell. Just me."

Evelyn turned, her face brightening. "Julian! What brings you here?"

He flashed a mysterious grin. "I've got a surprise for you."

Her curiosity piqued. "What kind of surprise?"

Julian clapped his hands dramatically. "Come in!"

A young woman entered, offering a polite smile. "Hello, I'm Katherine Whitaker."

Evelyn shot Julian a questioning look. "What's this about?"

He shrugged casually. "Now that Kingsley Industries has launched its talent division, we need fresh faces."

"Katherine here is my junior. She just wrapped a hit web series and her previous contract expired."
###Chapter 448 The Knowing Smile

Evelyn's eyes widened with sudden understanding. "Julian, are you suggesting we bring Katherine into Kingsley Industries?"

Julian gave a confirming nod. "That's precisely my thought."

Evelyn nodded but remained silent.

It was common knowledge in the industry that established actresses like Katherine, who already had fame and recognition, were difficult acquisitions for any company. After all, an actress only became profitable after gaining substantial popularity.

Yet here was Katherine, willingly offering to join Kingsley Industries.

"Ms. Carter, am I not welcome?" Katherine teased lightly.

"Of course you are! It would be an honor to have someone of your caliber join us, Ms. Whitaker."

"I'm looking forward to our collaboration!"

Katherine's gaze drifted to Julian standing beside her. The adoration in her eyes was unmistakable - any woman would recognize that look.

Evelyn understood immediately. This wasn't purely a career move for Katherine. There were other motives at play here.

Just as Evelyn was about to speak, her phone rang, interrupting the moment.

She glanced at the screen, and a flicker of disappointment crossed her features when she saw the caller ID.

After a brief hesitation, she answered. "Sophia? What's up?"

Evelyn couldn't help but glance at Julian and Katherine as she spoke.

"I heard you've established a talent division. You must have several rising stars needing sponsorships now?"

Evelyn chuckled. "I'm surprised you're so well-informed about our company developments, given how discreet you usually are."

"VERE happens to be looking for sponsorship opportunities this year. Natalie mentioned your new venture. This isn't a conversation for the phone. Shall we meet in person?"

"Absolutely! I'm at the office now. I'll have Maxwell come down to escort you."

"No need. I know my way around. I'll park in the garage and come up directly."

After hanging up, Evelyn turned to Julian. "Sophia will be here shortly."

Julian remained impassive. "You two can talk. I'll show Katherine around the premises."

Katherine? Evelyn's smile widened, though internally she was seething.

Since when had they become so familiar?

"Then I'll go with Julian. We'll catch up later."

Evelyn maintained a professional smile. "Of course! Go ahead."

Katherine offered a polite smile and turned to leave when Evelyn suddenly stopped Julian.

"Julian, wait. There's something I need to discuss with you."

Without hesitation, Julian murmured to Katherine, "Wait for me outside."

Katherine nodded obediently. "Of course!"

Once Katherine had exited, Evelyn grabbed Julian's arm urgently. "Julian, what exactly is your relationship with Katherine? What's really going on here?"

Julian looked genuinely perplexed as he raised his hands. "Didn't I just explain? She's my junior. She's had contract disputes with her previous agency and barely managed to get released. I saw an opportunity and did her a favor by introducing her to you."

"That's all there is to it?"

Evelyn clearly wasn't convinced. She couldn't forget the way Katherine had looked at him - that tender, affectionate gaze spoke volumes.
###Chapter 449 I Don't Have Feelings for Her

"Evelyn, what exactly are you trying to imply?"

Evelyn didn't mince words. "Julian, you don't have special feelings for her, do you?"

Julian finally understood her insinuation. He chuckled lightly. "Since when did you start meddling in my personal affairs?"

Seeing him evade the question made Evelyn anxious. "You're not developing feelings for Katherine, are you?"

Julian tapped her forehead with his finger. "What nonsense are you thinking? Katherine is merely my junior colleague, nothing beyond that."

Evelyn rubbed her forehead with a pout. "Katherine! You call her so affectionately. How can I be sure you're telling the truth?"

"Evelyn," Julian sighed in exasperation, "what must I say to convince you?"

"I believe you. But others might interpret things differently."

The way Katherine looked at Julian clearly suggested their relationship wasn't purely professional.

"Julian... I..."

"Enough, Evelyn! What are you trying to say?"

Her eyes darted as she gathered courage to ask the question weighing on her mind. "Is there someone you're interested in?"

An uncomfortable silence fell. A flicker of something unreadable passed through Julian's eyes before he schooled his expression.

"No."

His answer came swift and decisive.

Evelyn sighed inwardly for Sophia. All these years she'd watched Sophia harbor feelings for him, while Julian remained oblivious.

"Evelyn, if that's all, I should return to work."

Evelyn nodded. "Go ahead."

As Julian stepped out, he nearly collided with Sophia in the hallway. He paused, his gaze lingering on her.

"You're here too?" Sophia spoke first.

"Here to see Evelyn?"

Sophia nodded, fingers tightening around her bag strap. Without another word, she murmured, "I'll go in now."

She brushed past him, leaving a faint trace of her perfume in the air.

At that moment, Katherine returned from the restroom and immediately latched onto Julian's arm. "Julian, won't you give me a tour of the office?"

Sophia froze mid-step at the sound but didn't turn around. Instead, she knocked firmly on Evelyn's office door.

"Come in!"

Only after the door closed behind Sophia did Julian turn back, staring at the polished wood with an unreadable expression.

Katherine tilted her head curiously. "Julian, what are you looking at?"

Julian abruptly withdrew his arm. "At work, you should address me as Mr. Hartwell."

Katherine's face fell, her hand dropping awkwardly to her side. "Did I do something wrong?"

Julian studied her briefly before softening his tone. "No. But we must maintain professionalism in the workplace."

Katherine brightened instantly. "Understood."

"I have meetings shortly," Julian added. "My assistant will show you around instead."
###Chapter 450 Love's Enigmatic Dance

Katherine didn't show any displeasure. With perfect poise, she responded, "Don't worry about me. Focus on your work. I can explore on my own."

Julian felt a pang of guilt at her graciousness. "I'll have my assistant accompany you. Just let him know if you need anything."

"Of course."

The moment Julian disappeared around the corner, Katherine's smile vanished like morning mist. She turned slowly, her gaze lingering on the closed office door with an unsettling intensity.

...

Inside the office, Evelyn brightened upon seeing Sophia. "What brings you here unexpectedly?"

Sophia set down her designer handbag with a casual smile. "Just happened to be in the neighborhood."

Her eyes flickered downward as she asked nonchalantly, "Julian's here too?"

"Oh yes," Evelyn explained, "he came to support our new talent division. Just signed his exclusive contract with Kingsley Industries."

Sophia's eyebrows lifted in genuine surprise. "He signed with your company?"

"Absolutely. He's now our flagship celebrity."

Recognizing Sophia's unspoken feelings, Evelyn added carefully, "If VERE Jewelry sponsors us, Julian would be the primary beneficiary at this stage."

Sophia murmured something indistinct, letting the conversation lapse.

Evelyn reached for her hand. "Sophia, you could always tell him how you feel."

A shadow crossed Sophia's expressive eyes.

Her lips twisted into a bitter smile. "No. Some emotions are better left unspoken. This way... at least we can remain friends."

"But if you never voice them—"

"Sometimes ignorance is kinder."

Sophia met Evelyn's gaze squarely. "I overheard your conversation earlier, from the hallway."

"Don't take his words at face value," Evelyn insisted. Knowing Julian as she did, she couldn't believe he'd remained indifferent to Sophia all these years.

"Let it be. Love follows its own mysterious path," Sophia sighed, the resignation in her voice palpable.

Evelyn felt a surge of concern. She couldn't bear to see Julian miss out on someone as remarkable as Sophia.

"You truly believe that?"

Sophia nodded firmly.

Changing tactics, Evelyn mentioned casually, "Julian brought his protégée along today."

"Protégée?" Sophia's attention sharpened.

"Yes. Said her previous contract just ended, so he introduced her to us. He's been unusually attentive to her career."

Sophia's expression turned carefully neutral. "Is that so?"

But her gaze grew distant, betraying her racing thoughts.

Evelyn understood perfectly. A woman's heart has limited space—room only for the one who holds it.

Sophia's reaction confirmed everything. This might be the perfect opportunity to bring them together.

"So is VERE Jewelry considering sponsoring us?"

Sophia snapped back to the present. "Absolutely! We should always support our own."
###Chapter 451 Childhood Friends

"Perfect, now that we've agreed on terms, I'll have legal draft the paperwork. Assuming no issues arise, we can sign by week's end."

Sophia Whitmore gave a graceful nod. "Excellent. VERE is launching our new Celestial collection, and all pieces will be exclusively worn by Kingsley Industries' talent."

Evelyn Carter tapped her chin thoughtfully. "Let's feature Julian and Katherine. They're currently our most visible stars."

Sophia's gaze drifted toward the floor-to-ceiling windows as she murmured her assent.

"The entire quarter's red carpet jewelry will come from our atelier."

"I'll have their stylists coordinate directly with your team."

"Agreed."

As their meeting concluded, Evelyn personally escorted the jewelry designer downstairs. The elevator doors parted to reveal Katherine Whitaker lounging in the marble lobby.

Katherine's eyes snapped to Sophia with feline interest before addressing Evelyn. "Ms. Carter! What a pleasant surprise."

Seeing the unspoken question in the actress's eyes, Evelyn made introductions. "Katherine, meet Ms. Whitmore of VERE Jewelry - your new exclusive sponsor."

Recognition flashed across Katherine's features. VERE's avant-garde designs dominated international fashion magazines, their pieces coveted by every starlet in Hollywood.

Suddenly all business, Katherine extended a manicured hand. "Ms. Whitmore! Katherine Whitaker, signed to Kingsley's entertainment division. I'm thrilled by this collaboration."

Sophia offered a polite but distant smile. Without further engagement, she turned back to Evelyn. "Evie, I should head back to the studio. My team will handle the logistics."

"Of course."

As Sophia's heels clicked across the polished floors, Katherine couldn't suppress her curiosity. "Ms. Carter, you and Ms. Whitmore seem... unusually close."

Evelyn's lips curved at the memory. "We grew up together. Shared a sandbox before we shared business ventures."

Katherine's perfectly sculpted eyebrows lifted. This changed everything. No wonder Harrison Whitmore treated Sophia differently - it wasn't romantic history, but childhood ties to Evelyn.

"How lovely to maintain such friendships in our world," Katherine remarked smoothly.

Evelyn hummed in agreement when her phone vibrated with an incoming call. Her entire demeanor shifted as she saw the caller ID, her smile turning private and warm.

"Harrison?"

Katherine observed the transformation with clinical interest. Whoever was on the line held remarkable sway over the typically unflappable CEO.

Harrison Whitmore stood across the plaza, his gaze locked on Evelyn's silhouette through the glass walls.

"Harrison?" Evelyn's voice held a note of concern at his silence.

His low chuckle carried through the phone. "Turn around, darling."

Evelyn spun and immediately spotted his familiar frame. Without hesitation, she broke into a run, her designer heels be damned.
###Chapter 452 The Hidden Wound

Evelyn stood frozen in place, her sharp gaze scanning Harrison from head to toe. A wave of irritation washed over her when she saw him standing there perfectly intact.

Her lips pressed into a thin line. "Where the hell have you been these past days? I couldn't reach you at all. I thought you were—"

Harrison didn't let her finish. His strong arms enveloped her in a crushing embrace.

The familiar scent of his cologne instantly soothed Evelyn's frayed nerves. She melted against his chest, swallowing the angry words that had been on the tip of her tongue.

His warm breath tickled her ear as he murmured, "Forgive me for worrying you, Evie."

There had been unexpected complications at Whitmore Enterprises' headquarters. He'd been trapped in emergency meetings in Frenda with no access to outside communication.

The moment he'd seen her barrage of missed calls and texts, he'd boarded the first available flight. Straight from the airport, he'd come to Kingsley Industries—just to lay eyes on her sooner.

Evelyn pulled back with a scowl. "Your phone was completely dead. Not a single reply. Do you have any idea how—"

"I know," he interrupted, brushing a stray lock behind her ear. "It won't happen again."

Her eyes narrowed as she studied his face. The dark circles beneath his eyes made her stomach clench. "Harrison... did you come here directly after landing?"

A tired nod.

"I was afraid you'd worry. More afraid you'd be furious. Needed to apologize in person."

"So you haven't slept?"

His arms tightened around her waist. "Seeing you is all the rest I need."

"Release me. We're at work." Evelyn shoved against his chest.

When her hands connected with his left shoulder, Harrison hissed through clenched teeth, his face contorting in pain.

Evelyn's breath hitched. "You're hurt."

Her fingers trembled as she reached for his collar, but Harrison intercepted her wrist. "It's nothing serious."

The lie was obvious. She'd barely touched him, yet the pain had been unmistakable. "Show me. Now."

Her probing fingers found the edge of a bandage peeking above his shirt collar.

Evelyn's voice turned sharp. "What happened? How bad is it?"

The genuine concern in her eyes warmed something deep in Harrison's chest.

"Just a scratch. Barely worth mentioning."

"Like hell it is!" Evelyn's hands fisted in his jacket. "You came here injured? You should be resting!"

Harrison surrendered with a sigh. "Alright, alright."

"I'm taking you home."

A spark of amusement lit his tired eyes. "If you insist."

The drive to the Whitmore estate passed in tense silence. The moment they crossed the threshold, Evelyn was on him like a hawk.

"Let me see that injury. What really happened?"

In the grand living room, she peeled off his suit jacket with surgeon-like precision. When she lifted his dress shirt, the pristine white bandage came into view—marred by a faint crimson stain.

Harrison caught her trembling hands. "It looks worse than it is. The doctor already stitched it up."

Evelyn's lower lip quivered. "Why didn't you tell me? And another thing—when you disappeared, I realized I don't know a single person who can reach you directly. Never do this to me again."
###Chapter 453 Someone Special

The moment Evelyn finished speaking, Harrison's strong arms encircled her waist, pulling her flush against his chest. His warm breath tickled her ear as he murmured, "Alright."

Pressed so intimately against him, Evelyn could feel her heart pounding wildly, its frantic rhythm echoing through her entire body. She squirmed slightly, trying to create some distance between them.

"Where do you keep the first aid supplies? Let me take care of your injury."

"Don't trouble yourself. The physician already treated it."

"But it looks like the wound reopened," Evelyn insisted, already turning to search the room. Her eyes darted around anxiously, fingers twitching with nervous energy.

Harrison watched her frantic movements with amusement before rising gracefully. He crossed to a mahogany cabinet near the window. "The medical kit is here."

Flushing slightly at her own haste, Evelyn accepted the kit from him. "Sit down. I'll change your bandages."

Obediently, Harrison lowered himself onto the plush sofa, his piercing gaze never leaving her face as she worked. Evelyn's hands trembled slightly as she opened the kit and selected the necessary supplies. Her touch was feather-light as she carefully peeled back the soiled dressing, revealing the angry wound beneath.

The laceration appeared to be from some sharp implement - too clean and precise to be accidental. Evelyn's brow furrowed as suspicion prickled at the back of her mind.

"Harrison," she began cautiously, "how did this really happen?"

He offered her an easy smile that didn't quite reach his eyes. "Just a minor mishap. Nothing to concern yourself over."

Recognizing his evasion, Evelyn decided not to push further. "You need to be more careful," she chided gently, dabbing antiseptic onto the wound with meticulous care. "I don't like seeing you hurt."

As she worked, tiny beads of perspiration formed on her forehead, evidence of her intense concentration. When the fresh bandage was finally secured, Evelyn exhaled in relief.

"You'll need to change this dressing regularly for proper healing."

"Your wish is my command," Harrison replied with a playful smirk.

While Evelyn repacked the medical supplies, Harrison seized the opportunity to make a quick call. "My office. Five minutes," was all he said before ending the connection.

Curiosity got the better of Evelyn. "Who was that?"

Harrison's eyes twinkled with secret amusement. "You'll see."

True to his word, the doorbell chimed moments later. Evelyn moved to answer it, but Harrison caught her wrist gently. "No need. He knows his way around."

Before Evelyn could question further, the door swung open to reveal a stern-faced stranger. The man carried himself with military precision, his expression unreadable as he bowed slightly at the waist.

"Miss Carter," he greeted respectfully.

Evelyn blinked in surprise. "You know me?"

Harrison smoothly interjected, "Evelyn, this is Phillip Blackwood, my personal attaché."

"Your attaché?"

"If you ever can't reach me directly," Harrison explained, "Phillip will always know where to find me."

On cue, Phillip produced an embossed business card from his breast pocket. "My direct line, Miss Carter."

Evelyn accepted the card, still processing this development. "Harrison, what's all this about?"

His expression softened as he reached for her hand. "So you'll never have to wonder where I am again."

Understanding dawned, warming Evelyn from within. She'd mentioned her concerns only in passing, yet Harrison had not only remembered but taken concrete steps to ease her worries.

A tender smile curved her lips as she squeezed his hand. "Thank you. I understand now."
###Chapter 454 His Private World

Harrison turned to Phillip with a commanding tone. "From now on, Evelyn has full access to my schedule. Answer all her questions truthfully."

Phillip's eyes widened in shock. As Harrison's longtime shadow operative, he knew the gravity of this instruction. The Whitmore heir had countless enemies from years of corporate warfare. His movements were always classified information.

For over a decade, Phillip had operated in complete secrecy. Not a single public record tied him to Harrison. Yet now, his existence was being revealed to this woman without hesitation.

The message was clear - Harrison trusted Evelyn completely.

"Understood, Mr. Whitmore," Phillip responded immediately. His loyalty never wavered.

If Harrison placed his faith in Evelyn, then Phillip would too.

"You're dismissed."

"Yes, sir."

As Phillip exited, Harrison took Evelyn's hand gently. "Evie, I need to handle some... delicate matters tonight."

Evelyn had sensed the shift in his demeanor but knew better than to pry.

She simply nodded, meeting his intense gaze. "Just promise me one thing - come back in one piece."

"I promise."

The air between them grew charged as Harrison studied her face. Evelyn's reflection shimmered in his dark eyes, creating an intimacy that made her pulse quicken.

She took an instinctive step backward. "I should head home now."

Harrison caught her wrist effortlessly. "It's past midnight. Not safe."

Evelyn blinked, then flushed crimson as realization dawned. "Oh! No, that's... I couldn't possibly..."

An indulgent smile played on Harrison's lips, though he made no move to cross boundaries. He could feel Evelyn gradually opening up to him.

There was no need to rush.

"Take the master suite. I'll use the guest room. Just for tonight." His voice dropped to a conspiratorial whisper. "Otherwise Beatrice will have my head for letting you go home this late."

Trapped by his mother's hypothetical wrath, Evelyn had no choice but to agree.

"Alright. Goodnight then!"

She practically sprinted up the stairs like a startled deer, slamming the master bedroom door behind her before exhaling sharply.

Pressing cool palms to her burning cheeks, Evelyn scolded herself for acting so skittish.

Once composed, she finally took in her surroundings properly.

This was Harrison's inner sanctum. The room exuded quiet luxury - dark wood furnishings, crisp linens, and an understated elegance that mirrored the man himself.

"Goodness!" Evelyn gasped, spotting the illuminated display case.

Rows upon rows of rare comic book figurines stood in perfect formation, each one a collector's dream.

"Since when did Harrison become such a geek?" she wondered aloud.

The discovery triggered memories of her own childhood obsession with superheroes. Her collection still gathered dust somewhere at Kingsley Manor, untouched for years.

Evelyn shook her head with a wistful smile. "How time flies."

As she turned to leave, something glinted in the dim light, freezing her in place. Her breath caught as she recognized the object resting on Harrison's nightstand.
###Chapter 455 Spend More Time With Her

"What has caught your attention?" Harrison's voice broke through Evelyn's reverie, yet her eyes stayed locked on a decorative piece across the room.

She gestured toward the ornament. "Harrison, why do you have this exact same porcelain rocking horse?"

His gaze followed hers, lips curving slightly. "Do you possess one as well?"

Evelyn nodded, fingers tightening around the pajama set he'd handed her. "Identical to yours. Though mine shattered years ago." She turned away, voice dropping to a whisper. "Beyond repair."

A shadow flickered through Harrison's eyes, quickly masked. "What an unfortunate loss."

He extended a plush towel toward her. "You should retire early tonight."

"I will." She accepted the items, forcing a small smile. "You should rest too. Goodnight."

The moment the door clicked shut behind him, Evelyn exhaled sharply. The pajama fabric felt impossibly soft between her fingers.

Meanwhile, Nathan Sterling's limousine rolled through the wrought iron gates of Sterling Manor well past midnight. The scent of expensive whiskey clung to his tailored suit as he slumped against the leather seats.

"Sir, we've arrived." The driver's voice cut through the alcohol haze.

Nathan blinked at the familiar silhouette of his family home. With sluggish movements, he loosened his tie and stepped into the chilled night air.

"Dismissed," he muttered without turning back.

The estate stood eerily silent. Moonlight washed over the sprawling mansion that now felt hollow. Six months ago, these halls echoed with Evelyn's laughter. Now only Margaret remained after he'd banished Eleanor and Vanessa.

"Mr. Sterling, you're home." Patricia materialized in the foyer, taking his coat with practiced efficiency. "Madam Winslow wished to dine with you tonight."

Nathan paused mid-step. "Is she asleep?"

"Retired an hour ago, sir." The housekeeper hesitated. "Though... there's something you should know."

His brow arched in question.

Patricia lowered her voice. "Madam's health has declined recently. She forbade us from troubling you, but... perhaps you could visit more often?"

The words struck like physical blows. Without responding, Nathan took the grand staircase two steps at a time.

At the master suite's threshold, he paused, listening to the faint coughs within. When he eased the door open, moonlight revealed Margaret's restless form.

"Let me adjust your blankets, Grandmother."

"Nathan?" The bedside lamp flickered on, illuminating Margaret's tired smile. "Don't trouble yourself, dear."

He froze, hand still outstretched. "I didn't mean to wake you."

"These old bones don't sleep much anymore." She patted the silk covers. "Another late business meeting? You're working yourself to exhaustion."

Nathan swallowed hard, the whiskey suddenly bitter on his tongue. The woman who'd once stood taller than oak trees now seemed fragile as the porcelain horse in Harrison's study.
###Chapter 456 Knowing Her Well

"I understand, Grandma Margaret. Please don't worry about me."

Evelyn Carter sighed deeply. "With just the two of us left in this mansion now, how can I not worry?"

Then, she hesitated before asking, "How is Nathan doing these days?"

At the mention of Nathan Sterling, Evelyn simply replied, "He's fine, Grandma. You don't need to concern yourself."

Margaret nodded knowingly. "Nathan has always been a good man. It's just... unfortunate how things turned out between you two. If only..." She trailed off, shaking her head. "No use dwelling on the past. You should get some rest now."

"Yes, Grandma. You should sleep too."

After leaving Margaret's room, Evelyn retreated to her own bedroom.

For the past three years, she had barely spent any time in this house, with Nathan handling everything. Now that their divorce was finalized, she found herself returning more often.

Yet, she couldn't help but miss the days when Nathan still lived here with her.

Evelyn pushed open the door, but there were no traces of Nathan left. Every reminder of him had been slowly erased over time.

She stood by the window, gazing at the city lights below. Without thinking, she reached for a cigarette, lighting it and taking a slow drag.

The smoke curled around her, wrapping her in a melancholic haze.

Unbeknownst to her, Margaret had quietly approached the doorway with the butler's support. Just as the butler was about to announce their presence, Margaret stopped him.

She watched Evelyn by the window, sighing softly before whispering, "Let's go. Help me back to my room."

"Of course, Madam."

Margaret had noticed the change in Evelyn and made a decision. "Bring me my phone tomorrow morning. I need to call Nathan."

"Understood, Madam."

——

The next morning, Evelyn woke up in Harrison Whitmore's guest room, blinking away the remnants of sleep. She checked her phone—nearly 8:00 AM.

"I actually slept in?" she murmured, quickly sitting up.

Her gaze landed on a neatly folded set of clothes beside the bed, clearly prepared for her.

Evelyn took them to the dressing room to change. The style was exactly to her taste, and the fit was impeccable.

It was almost too perfect.

Once dressed, she headed downstairs.

Harrison's voice called out from the dining room, "You're awake? Come have breakfast."

She followed the sound, only to nearly bump into him in the hallway.

He smiled, reaching out to take her hand. "Come on, let's eat."

He led her to the dining table, where an elaborate breakfast spread awaited—including her favorite cinnamon rolls.

"Did you make all this?" Evelyn asked in surprise.

Harrison pulled out a chair for her with a faint smile. "Try it."

Curious, she took a bite of the cinnamon roll. The taste was just as good as the ones from her favorite bakery.

"Harrison, this is amazing."

He handed her a glass of fresh milk.

"Eat as much as you want. After this, I'll take you to the office."
###Chapter 457 The Dating Game Begins

Evelyn's fingers curled around the warm mug of milk as she studied Harrison's profile. "Harrison, I never knew you could cook like this," she admitted, her voice laced with genuine surprise.

It amazed her how after all these years, he still managed to surprise her with hidden talents.

Harrison simply shrugged, his lips curving into that familiar half-smile. "Picked it up during my college years. Guess it finally came in useful."

What truly mattered was seeing the delight on her face as she tasted his cooking. Harrison lowered his gaze to hide his satisfaction.

"If you enjoy it, I could make this a regular thing."

Evelyn didn't even pause to consider. "Absolutely! I'd love that," she beamed.

—

After breakfast, Harrison drove Evelyn to Kingsley Industries.

She waved him off from the sidewalk, watching his car disappear around the corner before turning toward the building.

Julian materialized beside her the moment she stepped through the glass doors. "Evie!"

His sharp eyes scanned her from head to toe, making Evelyn shift uncomfortably.

"What's with the inspection?" she asked, adjusting her bag strap.

"Cut the act. Why weren't you home last night?"

A flush crept up Evelyn's neck. "I have no idea what you're talking about."

Julian crossed his arms, looking far too knowing. "That was Harrison Whitmore dropping you off, wasn't it? Spill. What's really going on between you two?"

"You're imagining things. We're just— I'm late for a meeting!" She sidestepped him, making a break for the elevators.

Julian's laughter followed her. "My baby sister's all grown up!"

"Julian!" Evelyn's cheeks burned crimson.

He held up his hands in surrender. "Alright, I'll stop teasing. He seems decent enough, but if he wants to date my sister, he'll have to pass inspection."

Like hell he'd let his baby sister go that easily!

And Dominic and Elliot would be even tougher judges. Those two would eat potential suitors for breakfast.

Julian's smirk widened as he mentally catalogued ways to test Harrison's mettle.

Unexpectedly, Evelyn turned the tables. "Julian, maybe you should focus on your own love life. Quality women don't grow on trees, you know."

Julian blinked. "What's that supposed to mean?"

Evelyn batted her lashes innocently and patted his shoulder. "Are you really that oblivious? Haven't you noticed anyone special lately?"

Julian opened his mouth, then closed it.

"Seriously! You're not getting any younger. When are you going to find me a sister-in-law?"

With that parting shot, Evelyn sauntered off, leaving Julian gaping after her.

"How did this conversation become about me?" he muttered.

Yet the idea of dating didn't sound entirely unappealing. A certain face flashed through his mind, and Julian shook his head violently.

"Damn it, why did I think of her? No, no, no! That's just wrong!" He hurried after Evelyn, muttering to himself.

—

Evelyn was still smiling when she reached her office.

Her phone buzzed the moment she sat down. The caller ID made her eyebrows shoot up.

"Grandmother! What a lovely surprise!"
###Chapter 458 Her Only Comfort

"Evelyn, you must be exhausted from work lately," Margaret said softly.

Evelyn gave a gentle smile. "It's manageable. Kingsley Industries is finally stabilizing."

"Good. That's wonderful news," Margaret replied before breaking into a series of coughs that made Evelyn's brow furrow with concern.

"Grandma, are you feeling alright?"

"Just my usual ailments, dear. Nothing to fuss over."

Evelyn's heart clenched. During her three years with the Sterling family, Margaret had been her sole source of warmth and comfort in that cold mansion.

"Have you seen Dr. Whitmore about this?"

"Yes, yes. Don't trouble yourself over an old woman. I simply called because I've missed our chats."

"I'll come visit after work today."

Margaret's voice brightened instantly. "Truly? Oh, that would make my week! This empty house feels so lifeless these days. Your visits are the highlight of my days."

"Grandma, you know you're family to me."

Tears welled in Margaret's eyes at the words. "You've always had such a kind heart, Evelyn! Now, I won't keep you from your work. I'll see you this evening."

As Evelyn set down her phone, a crisp knock sounded at her office door. Maxwell entered with professional efficiency.

"Ms. Carter, Mr. Thornton from Horizon Technologies has arrived."

Evelyn nodded. "Please escort him to Conference Room B. I'll be there shortly."

"Of course."

Gathering the necessary documents, Evelyn smoothed her blazer and headed out.

The negotiation with Matthias proceeded remarkably well, culminating in both companies signing a partnership agreement by afternoon.

Matthias examined the contract with satisfaction.

"Ms. Carter," he said, extending his hand, "I look forward to our collaboration."

"The feeling is mutual, Mr. Thornton. I'm eager to learn from your expertise."

"Now you're being modest," Matthias chuckled. "With your reputation in the tech industry, this will be a partnership of equals."

"You flatter me, Mr. Thornton. Your experience is what we value most," Evelyn replied with genuine humility that earned Matthias's respect.

"Shall we?"

"After you."

Their pleasant exchange continued as the group exited, creating an atmosphere of professional harmony.

From his vantage point, Julian Hawthorne watched with a deepening scowl.

His assistant murmured, "Mr. Hawthorne, Ms. Carter's deal with Horizon appears finalized. They've signed contracts already."

Julian's lips curled in disdain. "Hmph. Youthful recklessness. What substantial results can she possibly achieve?"

His gaze hardened with contempt. "Let the girl play at business. Every fledgling needs to fall before they learn to fly properly."

"What's our next move, sir?"

Julian's expression turned calculating. "She thinks the digital economy is her golden ticket, but she's forgotten that virtual platforms can't compete with tangible assets. This time, not even divine intervention can save her ambitions."

Suddenly remembering something crucial, Julian turned sharply. "Did you discover who purchased the Eastwood property?"
###Chapter 459 Mutual Interest

The assistant swiftly passed the documents to Julian. "I've located it, Mr. Hawthorne. The Eastwood property was acquired by the newly formed Blackwood Group."

"Interesting. A startup company daring enough to snatch such prime real estate?" Julian's eyebrows shot up in surprise. "What else did you uncover?"

"Mr. Hawthorne, Blackwood Group isn't your average new company. Our research indicates connections to the former Delaney Corporation and the Sterling family."

"Precisely!"
